review:
Jogo free honesto, com craft e hunt hardcore, tem o visual do Ãºltima e Ã© survivor clÃ¡ssico, que onde vocÃª tem que craftar tudo tem uma grande quantidade de itens para serem craftados. Um jogo que te pune de verdade se sÃ£o souber como caÃ§ar e como guardar recursos.

Claro que tem uma opÃ§Ã£o de loja onde vocÃª consegue comprar tudo para o jogos ficar muito mais fÃ¡cil, mas o jogo nÃ£o te obriga a comprar nada, na verdade se vocÃª nÃ£o for na loja vocÃª nÃ£o vai notar que Ã© um jogo com microtransaÃ§Ãµes.
A mÃºsica Ã© empolgante, lembra muito as mÃºsicas do jogo Total Annihilation da cavedog.
Os grÃ¡ficos sÃ£o estilo Ãºltima. O jogo Ã© todo ambientado na era medieval, onde ate agora os mobs sÃ£o, animais da fauna local.

A minha primeira morte foi para um rato rsrsr e muito fÃ¡cil morrer nesse jogo, jÃ¡ morri umas 20 vezes, se vocÃª morrer vocÃª tem 30 minutos para voltar atÃ© seu corpo, boa sorte.
Como disse, o jogo te penaliza, (se nÃ£o me falha a memÃ³ria o jogo Ã© feito por um russo, entÃ£o pra eles Ã© uma segunda qualquer), por exemplo cada fez que vocÃª entra no jogo vocÃª tem um tempo devida no servidor, por exemplo entrando hoje vocÃª tem 10 dias, se vocÃª nÃ£o entrar nesses 10 dias os itens que vocÃª construiu comeÃ§arÃ£o a deteriorar.
E tambÃ©m nÃ£o tem nenhuma facilidade, como, por exemplo, ordenar os itens no inventÃ¡rio, tudo tem que ser feito na mÃ£o.
Outro detalhe por escolha do desenvolvedor o jogo nÃ£o tem mapa e a cabo concordando com ele, pois assim o jogo fica mais difÃ­cil e menos mecÃ¢nico, Pois com o mapa vocÃª anda de um lado para outro automaticamente, nÃ£o conhecendo e aprendendo sobre a fauna e flora do local.

O jogo Ã© difÃ­cil como os antigos jogos de 1980, tem uma curva de aprendizagem bem cruel, mas bastante compensador quando vocÃª consegue fazer alguma receita.
Por exemplo vocÃª alÃ©m dos itens para fazer a receita, vocÃª tem que ter a habilidade para tal receita, e se vocÃª fracassar, vocÃª perde todos os itens e tem que tentar de novo.
Na hora de construir tem pensar muito onde colocar os itens, jÃ¡ que nÃ£o existe a opÃ§Ã£o de mover a estrutura, se vocÃª se arrependeu de onde foi construÃ­da a estrutura, vocÃª vai ter que derrubar perdendo todo o material gasto e reconstruir em um novo lugar.

A Ãºnica facilidade do jogo Ã© que tem servidores separados para PVP e PVE.

Resumindo, recomendo muito para quem quer sair dos RPGs padrÃ£o e quer tentar se aventurar em um mundo desconhecido e que lhe oferece um caminho Ã¡rduo mas gratificante.
Digo que no comeÃ§o nÃ£o gostei do jogo mas depois que morri para o rato acabou sendo uma questÃ£o de honra prosperar no jogo e acabei sendo sugado para esse jogo e espero que quem tentar acabe gostando como eu.

Obrigado a todos que tiveram a paciÃªncia de ler atÃ© aqui.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025703168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1698556912}
review:
Right so I wanted to really like this game.. At first it was good, right up until I ha a friend join me.. this was a nightmare.. could not add/join a team or group whatever they call it.. there is zero info really to help you at the start of the game as you are just tossed into the game and well have to figure it out.
This wouldn't be an issue if it wasn't for issues like not being able to team up with others for whatever unforeseeable reason.
Also does not help that there are random very high level monsters and animals randomly placed.. i was killed by some kinda pumpkin then over an over to multiple other animals while trying to reach my body... the server community.. heh.. well the one person that "tried" to help couldn't even speak English and had to use google translate.. this was a sh*t-show also.. they claimed to have played the game for 4 years but still couldn't understand the fact i could not join a group and when I tried to invite them .. well they couldn't understand that they weren't getting the invites either.. 
With that being said.. have your own experience i just hope it wasn't like mine.. 

F THIS GAME!

review: Jogo classico e maravilhoso. author: {'steamid': '76561198061243727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1686615479}
review:
It is super annoying to get the first 40+ dummy tasks and you will keep dying all the time because we cannot see far and when we see strong animals it's too late. Bears and Wolfs will easily kill you in the first day.
It is not bad. Since it is free, I suggest you try it. Lovely graphics (not great, but acceptable). Could be better if the bugs allow you do things outside the small 'missions/quests' of basic things. Easily get stuck in the things and player walks VERY slowly though the map. So everything takes too much time to do. Lot's of room to improve skills, items and the character could have attributes in a more "ultima online" way.

review: Awesome game,i have a lots of hours in browser version.It is hardcore mmorpg survival with interesting exploration skills where you can find secret treasures,pvp is also fun,although you need a lot of time to make a guild which could be a cons imo and steam and browser version does not sync with steam version.A lot of in depth game mechanics and awesome game which rewards you for exploring it's world.Although in the begining it forces you a bit to play with range later on you can play as full melee character most of the time,everything ingame can be obtaing by exploring the map corpses and godsends to loot your recipes, you can even get a mount like that!!!A true masterpiece!!!

review:
Eigentlich war Wild Terra mal ganz in Ordnung, nur die Fresserei war mir einfach zu viel, ich war der Meinung, wenn man den Bedarf an Essen halbieren wÃ¼rde, wÃ¤re es ertrÃ¤glich ... Was kam dann ? Ein Update, nachdem man jetzt sogar das Doppelte an Essen benÃ¶tigt, kaum ist man wenige Meter gelaufen, muss man schon wieder etwas essen ! Dazu kommen noch die Leichenratten, die jetzt Ã¼berall sind, RÃ¤uber die aus Leichen kommen, noch mehr gefÃ¤hrliche Tiere, man kann kaum noch in Frieden spielen. Die Russen versauen wirklich jedes Spiel, ich glaube, sie wollen die Spieler los werden um dann die Server zu schlieÃŸen !
Also, Finger weg von diesem Spiel ! Sollten sie die letzten Updates wieder rÃ¼ckgÃ¤ngig machen, kÃ¶nnte man Wild Terra auch wieder empfehlen !

author: {'steamid': '76561198080389183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 55551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 54763, 'last_played': 1712418014}
review:
Nun, nach Ã¼ber 900 Stunden in Game, ist es an der Zeit, zurÃ¼ckzublicken.
Versteht mich nicht falsch: Es hat immer mal wieder SpaÃŸ gemacht. Dieses Spiel hat einige interessante Mechaniken, die einen eine zeitlang bei Laune halten kÃ¶nnen.
Leider hat das Spiel auch immer mehr Ecken und Kanten, die einem den SpielespaÃŸ doch sehr versauen.
Dass die Entwickler recht bald nachdem ich das Spiel zu spielen begonnen hatte, die Singleserverfunktion herausgenommen haben (obwohl damit noch immer beworben wurde) - ok, das habe ich ihnen verziehen).
Dass man Stunden damit verbringen sollte, um sogenannte Rezeptteile zu suchen, damit man etwas herstellen kann - auch das habe ich offensichtlich akzeptiert und schlieÃŸlich sogar Dank meiner Ungeduld dem p2w-Prinzip nachgegeben.
Jetzt frag ich mich, wofÃ¼r.
Nach recht langer Abwesenheit komme ich zurÃ¼ck ins Spiel, nur um festzustellen, dass ich absolut NICHTS mehr herstellen kann. Und ich habe hunderte Stunden dafÃ¼r investiert um eben genau das zu kÃ¶nnen.
Jetzt soll ich das alles noch mal machen?! Really?
Ich finde es ja durchaus lobenswert, dass neuer Content integriert wurde und die bestÃ¤ndigen Events sind auch ok. Aber es hÃ¤tte doch gewiss eine andere LÃ¶sung gegeben, als fast alles "zurÃ¼ck auf Null" zu setzen.
Vor allem bei Dingen, die ich via ECHTGELD gekauft habe.
Wenn das die Zukunft von WT1 ist, verstehe ich, wieso immer weniger Spieler diesem Game treu bleiben. Ich bin jedenfalls stark am Ã¼berlegen, ob ich nicht einfach alles zerstÃ¶re, das Spiel deinstalliere und nie wieder einen Gedanken daran verschwende.
Fakt ist: Da ich jetzt weiÃŸ, was ich zu erwarten habe, werde ich WT2 garantiert nicht spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093867713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14537, 'last_played': 1646084032}
review:
I think the game is ok, I played a lot of hours, even when there are only a few people playing it. But today, suddenly the game kicked me out and displayed the message "You should buy the game to play". The worst part is that itÂ´s not possible to buy it since it is supposedly free, you only can buy some content packs. 
So, even when I enjoyed the game I donÂ´t advise you to play it.

edit 25/0222

The problem with the login was solved, so... 
I go on playing, as I said before I like the game. If you like survival rpgs, farming, hunting, crafting, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056093224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 11930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11183, 'last_played': 1679955801}
review:
I Really like this game. 

Why? I like old/classic isometric graphics, and i don't mind what some people would call "clunky, movement and combat". I enjoy it a lot. Its got complex crafting, and an old school skill-er feel to it, its exciting on the PvP servers, (which is half the reason i am here, the other half being a survival crafting game) and its challenging!

It can be a grind, but depending on how you do things, and how you utilise your skills and tools it can take anywhere from 3 days to 2 hours to level up a skill in the late game. 

There is a huge pay to win factor, although everything -except a few special tools- is available to F2P players, as it is to P2P players, via playing, farming, grinding, exploring, fighting. AND having never spent a dime myself, I want you to know that this is one of the few games {I've seen} where grinding it out and farming can actually be BETTER, then buying. 

The Cons: 
NA Pvp server is not very populated. 
and development has stopped, as they have released Wild Terra 2. 

My one wish, is that they continued to develop, as i think it is a better game then WT2 by far. (Personal opinion)

Tips/things to know: stick to official servers. know that characters are tied to the server they are in, (unless you BUY a server change scroll). You base will Decay after 20 days of inactivity, and you will loose all your structures, containers and items, (unless you BUY a 60$ Eternal scroll).
The game is older/not modern. Enjoy!

review: For being a MMO this was about as deserted as the moon. I didn't play long, but I saw evidence of players but not themselves. Just what they had built and I assume left in the wild. Its a shame because it has a very neat Ultima Online feel that I miss. If you've got someone to play with, this would be great. Solo, maybe not as much. If you want to treat it like your own personal server (IE: You're ok with playing alone) it shouldn't be a problem. Its nice but very lonely.

review: I was browsing isometric games and I stumbled across this gem. I have been playing isometric 2D MMORPGs since I was 12 years only, I am now 32, and this game took me by the hair with its depth, topped off with the VAST AMOUNT OF CONTENT, topped off with the fact that its an MMO. I highly recommend you give this game a shot, you will not be sorry, but buckle up if you decided to play on the open world PVP server, I never do it any other way. [i]~Dezra Diamondsun[/i]

The same things every year, every event is the same.
Grind is real.. LIKE THE GRIND IS THE GAME.

It may take weeks to build castle walls. Depends how big is the castle.
Heavily based on PTP bases.
Yo can try it buts its slow grind and almost dead anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561199054709759', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 183051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78510, 'last_played': 1657964579}
review:
Well, it has been 1308 hours already... This application does NOT worth to spend money on, have to admit.
1. Local community is very small, consists mostly of hopeless game addicts having 3-4-5 or more accounts, so it is completely unclear whom you're trying to help
2. Lots of griefers (ragtag and bobtail), even on PVE servers, who do NOT have any sense of humour but only swears|curses|attempts to provoke
3. Glitches and bugs, there are many of them. Since it is a web-browser application, these are:
+ non-found content (404 in google chrome console window F12)
+ invisible walls, these are classics for many games
+ content disappears on some occasions, for example, if 1 of guards (NPC) faces invisible wall or any fence of any castle
+ slow content downloading/synchronization during spikes of activity and in SOME zones as well
4. Payments|donations do not work properly under Linux OS (Debian GNU/Linux 9 (stretch)), you will have to debug lots of URLs until you will find out the true reason and then to resemble authorization process manually. Reports regarding the problem to support@xsolla.com leaded to non meaningful results... Even with 10 (!!!) screenshots describing every stage of purchase through game shop
5. support@playwilterra.com does not want to collaborate at all, but BANs players in chat on sight, haha
For example:
Recipient inbox full
Your message couldn't be delivered to support@playwildterra.com. Their inbox is full or it's receiving too much mail at the moment. 

The response from the remote server was:
552 5.2.2 Mailbox size limit exceeded 1620407468-yHspZvzswu-B7cG99QN

author: {'steamid': '76561198025541406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1615146427}
review:
Game is interesting, and in ways fun

The grind is real and decisions to make Guild creation End game (close to end Game) tier is fustrating.

The devs need to set the guild creation to a managable level say medium or even large. 

right now this feels too much like a push to pay us or never get to do things type situation.

Was looking for a fun game to play with my kids and wife, not a sink whole of drudgery that encourages spending real money ontop of effort

author: {'steamid': '76561198242721592', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 101076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97740, 'last_played': 1686801650}
review:
I've played over 1600 hrs on this game, and although I may leave it alone for a while, I always return.  As a recluse/hermit, I have no problems with the PVE servers being pretty much empty of players *smiles*. 
I love how I was never "spoonfed" the intricacies of WT. A short tutorial, and then it's up to you to click on stuff to find out how to do something- and the steps to building/crafting/cooking are often very indepth. ( Handy Hint: write steps down in a notebook lol)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030858802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1610186685}
review:
The "mission" line is really painful and inventory management is the most punishing I've ever encountered.

The missions themselves  are pretty basic.  Stuff like "Eat a carrot".  That was about my third or fourth mission.  Eating a carrot takes a second, but finding the carrot took me almost an hour.  By which time, I had harvested so much stuff that my bag was full and I was having to throw stuff away - not knowing whether it was of any use or not.  Of my 1.8 hours of playtime, half would have been spent looking for the carrot.

The missions are sequential and must be completed sequentially - it doesn't matter if you have already previously done what the mission is asking while you spent an hour looking for that stupid carrot!!!  This probably wouldn't be so painful if inventory management wasn't such a pain.    

I thought the purpose of the missions was to be like a tutorial to give an idea of how to do things.  But no....  The missions started repeating.  I envisioned another hour of looking for another carrot and decided this game probably isn't for me.

At this stage it becomes a game of deciding what to throw out of the backpack so there is room to do the next mission.  Or alternatively, having to search your baskets on the ground to find the items needed for the current mission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334363359', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1667262679}
review:
I've only played for 19 hours thus far, but I really think this is a game I would keep coming back to. I understand the second game is coming out soon and I'll play this casually until that comes out and see if I'm interested in that as well. 

I like the survival aspects of the game and you always have something to do and micromanage. You can juggles several activities like smelting ores, making sure you've burned enough logs for charcoal, tanning hides, cooking, and even just making sure you don't get eaten by bears and wolves every 5 seconds.

This is super run on but I do like this game so far. I've only played on the PvE server and while I haven't run into many people, the people that I have seen are extremely friendly. Someone went out of their way to give me 2 free horses! Give this game a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198963202229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1607872944}
review: IÂ´m pretty new to this game, I had planned to first play this one and purchase the new version 2 when it launches, but I have several issues with that. First I can not expand when I want to, I receive the message that IÂ´m not allowed to expand my little space by somebody ??? But who ??? I had to delete all my stuff which I had build after gathering like crazy, because you CANÂ´T move anything!!! And this is not logical to me, you cannot move a simple basket to re-arange your camp. IÂ´ve looked at the wiki page for this game from main menu and I only found pages about editing the wiki, so no content about my questions. After all these years of developement they didnÂ´t manage to fully translate the game into German, here and there I got english messages, for example for making coal. In German you have to "kÃ¶hler holz" into coal, but I didnÂ´t find a "kÃ¶hlerei" to do that. My wife managed to settle next to me, but had to left everything behind because for moving you need a certificate.. but from where or from who??? The game is not self explaining at all. After I died from a wolf attack I died 2 times while trying to reach my first body, to get my stuff back, but there is only one arrow showing the position of the last body, not the previous. IÂ´ve played hundred/thousand of hours on games like this, Rimworld, LIF, Banished, Kingdoms reborn, Hammerting, Foundation, Craft the World, but I have never encountered such stupid game mechanics. In the beginning I was wondered why there were so many abandoned places with just a stone and a bed, nothing more, but now I know all these ppl left the game after an hour or so trying. The server is filled with abandoned structures, which leads me to another question: why canÂ´t we play this game locally ? I mean just with friend over LAN or just as a single player to learn the basics? Recently IÂ´ve watched some game reviews for next version 2 and I donÂ´t think thereÂ´s much improvement except the graphical overlay (you can zoom-in and turn the screen around) also the new has a map, this one doesnÂ´t. This game is free to play, maybe to attract ppl to later buy the new release, but in my opinion this will keep new players away from their products.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081302459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1604098387}
review: Didn't really play too much, because it was so boring. You start with a few tutorial missions, but the indications are severely lacking, and the part of the world where I started was so empty that I spent 20 minutes looking for some mushrooms or a hare to progress. Pathfinding is incredibly bad, and you get stuck all the time. And the graphics are similar to those of games from the 90s, not of a 2017 title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043095646', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1603906907}
review:
From what I understand, the game went free and it lead a lot of people to be angry, which is understandable.

However, if you like deep and complex crafting system, with isometric graphics where you can do almost anything the way you want it, then consider checking the game. There is a premium subscription you can pay for, however free players are not limited in what they can do. 

Nice.

nao existe servidor PVE BR, se voce quiser jogar ja vai ter que ir de cara no PVP onde todo mundo ja ta upado no talo no dinheiro, e se voce for querer jogar no servidor PVE do EUA, vai ficar te mostrando direto uma mensagem do tipo "sua conexÃ£o foi perdida" e com isso voce nao fica nem 10 segundos no mapa te forÃ§ando ir pro servidor BR, que na verdade nem BR Ã©, se chama "amÃ©rica do sul".

author: {'steamid': '76561198441136056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1602544579}
review:
The game itself seems VERY fun and addictive. The main issue I'm having is the 20 second-3 minute load time to load the maps off screen as I'm walking, causing targets I'm hunting to get away or just take ages to get anywhere or find anything. Please fix this, even in the low graphic mode i Have the same issue. This is really a game breaking issue & my internet is fine.

Aside of that, the game has quite a few bugs and latency issues with mobs attacking me when not visible or game not letting me revive after death

author: {'steamid': '76561198047464591', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 6028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3016, 'last_played': 1598245605}
review:
Has a bit of an old Runescape vibe without the quests.  The resource management can get pretty tedious though.

Also, don't bother unless you can log in at various times of the day because farming will require you show back up within a specific window of time to harvest your crops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056028289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5778, 'last_played': 1644375895}
review:
I don't recommend this and any other "Juvty Worlds Ltd." although I only played this one and I will explain why.
I PAID for the game is in beta. Shortly thereafter, the game was released FREE, still poorly optimized and the company gave some compensation items to those who had paid for it. Now, instead of finishing optimizing the game, "Juvty Worlds Ltd." re-launched the same game, but this time optimized, like "Wild Terra II".
This is a total lack of respect for the people who paid for that first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1589555162}
review:
Wild Terra Online is an abandoned "Freemium" online multiplayer-only isometric survival/ARPG with a medieval/fantasy theme.   It's very much a Diablo 1 clone with survival/crafting features nailed clumsily on top. 

While the game is online only, online is dead.   The developers are at least keeping some of their servers up, probably because of the lynching they'd get if they dropped them.    Graphics are quite bad, the gameplay is amazingly clunky and just feels bad.   Survival mechanics are weak and grindy, and completely unsatisfying. 

Development has effectively ceased for this as the developers work on "Wild Terra 2", basically the same game with a higher version number, so they can gouge more from Steam and game bundle sales.   The dodgy devs sold the game for cash first, to gouge out early players with no clear intention to deliver on their promises (Wild Terra 2 proves this), then made the game "Freemium" with a whopping $105 worth of crappy "DLC".   There's understandable indignation from the people who paid money for this when it became obvious the developers had shady intentions from the beginning. 

I have no problem with the general concept of Freemium games when done right, because they can afford a huge amount of enjoyment for a huge number of players, and make their money from selling cosmetics and pay-2-grind bonuses, but the developers here are plain gouging, with a broken core game and pointless DLC on top.  They're black hearted, reprehensible scumbags.   Don't bother downloading this rubbish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296762487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1908, 'last_played': 1589662011}
review:
The game play is pretty good - exactly what I was looking for in a 'forage, craft, and build' survival sort of game. Enough variety in items to craft that you've not done everything in the first few hours, but not so much that you can't find anything. 

I like the gathering system where you can 'find' more interesting things as your abilities improve. It means you're frequently finding new things to find. There's a shop system so you can even trade goods with other players, though I personally find currency-currency easier to work with than the goods-currency this game uses, but I get that it's a thematic thing to do it the way it's done. 

The aesthetics are fine, not especially stylised in any way. I would say it's annoying that you need to find the option to change the display mode if you go inside, because for some reason it doesn't automatically remove the roof when you enter a building so that you can see where you're going. And I can't even find an option to hotkey this, so you need to either stay in that mode always, or frequently go into the menu and change the setting.

I find that my computer can be a little slow to pick up actions, and it gets confused between attacking and walking, so I'm glad there's a PVE option, because PVP would be impossible for me to succeed in combat. As it is, I have to corner the animals somewhere they can't escape to save hours of running after animals who run away before I can get shoot them. My laptop also randomly shuts down sometimes whilst playing. I'm pretty sure these are both specific to my computer though - it's a few years old and not really built for gaming. Even so, I'm managing to get enjoyable game time from the game. Because it's a multiplayer game, your actions are saved automatically, so you don't loose progress if for some reason you're not able to save before you exit.

I realise I've said a few negative things about the game, but I've basically listed all the negatives I could think of right now - I'm aware the devs are working on a version 2, so hoping some of these things have been/ can be considered in the next version. The game is overall pretty fun, and honestly what do you have to loose when it's free?

author: {'steamid': '76561198071309654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5780, 'last_played': 1590961863}
review: Not much could be said that has been said before. IF you are interested, understand you will waste weeks to maybe months of the same gameplay loop. Whaling is king in the game and fates smile on you if you decide to enjoy any seasonal even it seems, as the current event can spawn glitched and bugged out baskets. I have spent money on in game items foolishly and even bought this at early access. Crafting is fun but can be limiting and very time consuming though has a mechanic that might make you think twice about being a master craftsmen as your stats can and do eventually cap out which would make your character not combat effective, which will prohibit you from end game materials and content as both players and the mobs located in that region are and will be of higher combat stats. All in all, Its sub par enjoyment that reminds me of games that have done it better, Ultima and Wurm online come to mind most strongly and I would recommend you play those before looking into this one. Saddly this game and its design and mechanics leaves me to wonder if it was ever meant to be ported over for american use.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153465179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 12954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10965, 'last_played': 1603563039}
review:
The crafting system is very interesting and good. But there are bugs,little lag and wrong translations errors. But staff listen,take some time for the to fix things.
Recommend to join a guild, otherwise, the game can be pretty boring and repetetive at times.

After 200 hour's, it's pretty repetetive. Either level up your skills or gather blueprint scraps and get a blueprint you already have 8 of. I would recommend the develepors to make so there is a limit of 5 same blueprints MAX limit!

author: {'steamid': '76561198436960282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 27201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 13177, 'last_played': 1711543609}
review: What I like most about Wild Terra is that every item in the game has a purpose; there's nothing that cannot be used for some type of food or crafting.  Even bird crap has purpose as fertilizer for crops.    The single biggest failure of the game is the lack of a map.  The developers believe the map would take too much from the game, but there are many ways that mapping could be implemented such that higher intelligence, perception and cartography skill could be used to create better mapping accuracy if the developers wanted to pursue it, but they don't.  Mapping in computer games as been available as far back as "The Bard's Tale 2" on the Commodore 64, as I can recall.  All in all though, for roughly $10 US, it's been enjoyable all the same.  And if you're a closet hoarder, this game will suit you perfectly!  Save everything - eventually, you'll use it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996921477', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1585409829}
review:
Das Spiel ist eine nette Idee, jedoch dauert die Beschaffung der Materialen und auch das Crafting viel zu lange. Das Spiel ist aus meiner Sicht nur fÃ¼r Leute gedacht, die am besten nichts anderes spielen wollen, auÃŸer dieses Spiel. Von den ersten paar Stunden erinnert mich das Ganze an Life is Feudal, nur eben in 2D. 

Das Spiel erstickt, im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes, an der eigenen KomplexitÃ¤t. Ein Beispiel: Man fÃ¤llt einen Baum, man kann folgendes erhalten: kleine Ã„ste, groÃŸe Ã„ste, Baumstamm, Zweige. Um eine einzige Palisade zu bauen, benÃ¶tigt man Schnittholz und BaumstÃ¤mme.. um das Schnittholz zu erlangen, muss man BaumstÃ¤mme zu Schnittholz craften.. BaumstÃ¤mme bekommt man jedoch nur bei BÃ¤umen ab Level 10 und dann sind dies auch nur hÃ¶chstens 1-3 StÃ¤mmne.. bis man sich also einen kompletten Palisadenzaun um sein GrundstÃ¼ck herum bauen kann, braucht man fast schon eine Stunde, um alle benÃ¶tigten Materialen zu sammeln. Zwischendurch muss man sein Inventar mehrmals von zu viel anderen Krimskrams leeren.

So zieht sich das jedoch Ã¼ber jedes baubares Item, GebÃ¤ude, u.s.w. hin. Wie gesagt, bei diesem Spiel muss man sehr viel Zeit mitbringen. Meiner Meinung nach zu viel Zeit und so macht das einfach keinen SpaÃŸ.

Things happened in life and forgot all about it. Saw it in my library and wanted to see what they did with updates. Private servers are not an option anymore. I enjoy playing with a small community which private servers were the reason I bought this...yes bought back when it costed money. I regret buying this trash. Uninstalled and will never play it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122699896', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1579195560}
review:
Things I liked
> isometric game with open world and base building
> lots of stuff to craft 

Things I hated:
> worst offender item durability ridiculously low and items disappear when durability zero, haven't seen any way to repair items (items should become like 50% efficacious at minimum durability not disappear)
> all items disappear when crafting fails (should be like 10% of materials not all) - this is thing makes me not recommend the game, crafting already has low success rates, punishment by making items disappear really sucks
> Poor UI and need to wait several seconds when doing anything including mounting
> no map and no mini map
> have only seen wild animals as enemies
> hunger meter fills too fast and takes LOTS of food to completely lower hunger
> heavy pay 2 win elements mixed with paid DLC
> only way to get new recipes is with cash or random loot which high level players can find much more easily, so no cash no getting high level, vicious cycle

author: {'steamid': '76561198074077022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11900, 'last_played': 1577592564}
review:
I enjoyed the game. I found it fun despite being f2p, though quite punishing if played as a solo player.

Based on my experience, the game is grindy and geared towards playing with a group. Your stats are limited which makes you choose to either become a fighter, crafter, or mixed. Alt accounts were recommended to me.

If playing solo, you'll spend a lot of time gathering and crafting to raise your levels. But I managed to find a clan through the official discord and they helped me raise my levels much more efficiently than if I was playing solo. Highly recommended joining their official discord and finding an active guild to play with instead of solo play.

The only downside is the low population. But none the less, I had fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306649890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1561843649}
review:
It is like every other MMO but give you choice to pay for advantages or go freestyle. 
I went freestyle and there tutorial to complete. 
In end of tutorial you get some means to purchase extra materials to craft your need to go upgrade your first home. You can't make second home unless you purchase NPC shops.

My overall like: it reminded me of balrum but had other players online where you talk co-op. 
My overall dislike: there was no means where you could find reasonable monsters who were your level all them were either lvl 25 somewhere on map you end up dead or loosing your gear. Resurrection viable after you make your first home.  Only biggest hint I could ever give at moment.

My overall opinion of game: It was good for play see what game was about, You join guild but there level requirement to join a guild, some require your home be up same level they are. Bandits and players do raid your home when you haven't been on for while. I was thinking joining guild but then why should I?  Requirements most guild would be have good time but these guilds there requests you play often and be punctual I like crap I joined another PK game. So if your into join guild that is quest from tutorial join one for little while then leave it. I am sorry just I feel some guilds require more of person's will. 

I don't advise this a game to play if want it be your first time in PK environment. Its okay but gloves go off when your protection is non existent. I never actually raided players or people for their resources, I found doing so makes me feel like peering into someone backyard and no that no go for me. Best do it for cause and some other means of notoriety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049023411', 'num_games_owned': 4587, 'num_reviews': 397, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1578389180}
review:
Little too slow for my tastes. Doesn't really show you what there is to look forward to if you invest a ton of time into it. Doing anything is a pain. How am I supposed to chop down a hundred trees to make a chest if I'm being murdered by wolves and starving because I can't find any carrots.

Also, couldn't find gunpowder, so the Gorn killed me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050452013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 6408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3782, 'last_played': 1581055280}
review: Started taking my reviews more  seriously. Too many fake news/disinformation and click-for-hire types out there making it harder to know what is real and what isn't. Since there are only 4 guys running this whole show, I have to tip my hat to them.  A quick search of Juvty Worlds Ltd. illustrates, in my mind, the struggle of 4 entrepreneurial minds trying to make a go of it in the world of capitalism.  None of negative reviews I've read are worth any serious note, simply people whining.  I would too, perhaps, if I didn't consider that these guys probably have to pay for your connect time in some fashion so they do not feel as ingratiated to your initial payment as you think. It was probably used to pay back money they borrowed from someone else or a back bill.  What I find MOST disturbing is that there are only 17 negative reviews, and my app says "Mostly Negative" in bright red letters on the list.  Why is that? As of today, 1388 MIXED revirews, 17 Negative - MOSTLY NEGATIVE it says. Looks suspect to me.  Anyway.  YOU CAN BUILD ANYWHERE! It is an actual open world.  For free, it is worth checking out, and while researching their mostly negative fake news, i found WILD TERRA 2, which I ALSO RECOMMEND! DON'T FEED THE TROLLS! THIS IS AN AWESOME GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069887490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1578017896}
review: It could be a really good game, but the lack of any kind of map is too much of an issue for me.  If there is no map, then, at least, let the players be able to scan their area more by using the mouse 'click and drag' action.  Even just a map of the general area would help so much!  Unfortunately, I am uninstalling the game.  No map makes it even worse than if you were actually in such an area (at least you could look further than a small square area around you).  I know the devs own preference rules here, but listening to the players is common sense. I may play again, if there is a map.  It's sad, because this could be a really good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204242548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 27141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2654, 'last_played': 1605472967}
review: Oddly enough, despite the obviously dated graphics,  I like this game.  To me this feels like my younger self is looking through my eyes and saying "This is the kind of thing I wished I could create when I was younger".   The logic in the game is good, the crafting works as intended, and yes, it is mostly a build-craft-hunt game.  So far no real NPC's  (but several dead bodies with loot).   The system in place is fairly easy to understand,  and although yes,  upgrading skills is grindy,  it actually does seem to reflect the "learning curve of life'.  Which is okay by me.  So I give it a 6.5 out of 10.  ( If the graphics were better it would get an 8/10 )

author: {'steamid': '76561198282568382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 139414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 17, 'playtime_at_review': 28628, 'last_played': 1711971200}
review:
Review Teil 2: (Spielzeit 1037 Stunden)

Wer extremes langwieriges Grinden fÃ¼r ein Open World Game ok findet, ist hier herzlich zu eingeladen. 0:-) 
Die Dinge die ich vorher geschrieben hatte, sind immer noch aktuell.
Ich habe allerdings viele Dinge, die ich dank der anderen internationalen Spieler, erlernen kÃ¶nnen, was meinen Spielespass jedes mal aufs neue anheizt.
Zum einen: man kann nicht alle 7 Attribute gleichzeitig von Lvl 5 (Basislevel) bis zum Maximum (Level 12)  erhÃ¶hen,. Das geht nur mit einem Attribut bzw. einem zweiten Attribut bis vielleicht  Lvl 10 gleichzeitig.Ich habe wert aufs Herstellen (Crafting) gelegt, womit ich das Intelligenzattribut auf mindestens Level 10 bringen muss. Dadurch sind aber fast alle anderen aufs level 6 begrenzt. 

Review Teil 1: (Spielzeit 477 Stunden)
Finger weg wenn man so ein Spiel alleine spielen mÃ¶chte! Weit Ã¼ber 400 Stunden und kein wirkliches VorwÃ¤rts kommen. Der/die Gab/s zwischen den einzelnen Lernstufen ist so enorm, das viele Spieler, wie ich anhand der verlassenen Basen/Domains gesehen habe, schon oft nach den ersten mageren Erfolgen aufgegeben haben.
Wenn ein Lvl 63 BÃ¤r, den man ausschlieÃŸlich nur von einer StahlrÃ¼stung an aufwÃ¤rts besiegen kann, ganz zu Anfang um die Basis/Domain herumschwirrt, ist das schon ein super negativ Effekt.
Und so ein BÃ¤r ist kein Einzelfall. WÃ¶lfe, FÃ¼chse, Wildschweine und Bullen, auch wenn, bis auf die WÃ¶lfe, keines davon Aggressiv ist, dÃ¼rfen diese von ihrem TÃ¶tungspotenzial her nicht unterschÃ¤tzt werden. 

Wenn man diese Spiel als Gilde spielen mÃ¶chte, was zu Empfehlen ist und man sollte mindestens drei Spieler sein, wird mindestens einer der Spieler jedoch hintenan bleiben. Man benÃ¶tigt so viele Ressourcen um aufzuleveln das alle Spieler ewig Rohmaterial heranschaffen mÃ¼ssen, was aber nicht fÃ¼r alle Spieler ausreichen wird.
Wenn ich schreibe Aufleveln meine ich nicht die Level die man in den verschiedenen Bereichen erreichen kann, sondern viel mehr das Aufleveln der AusrÃ¼stung, die bei weitem mehr Ausschlag auf den Erfolg des Spielziels hat als jedes der "Level" die man ansonsten im Spiel erreichen kann.
Aber, da diese besagten RÃ¼stungen erst nach Hunderten von Spielstunden zu erreichen sind, braucht man schon viel Geduld und Ausdauer um wirklichen Spielespass zu haben.
Ich habe versucht das Spiel alleine anzugehen, aber mit dem Ergebnis heute denke ich das ich das Spiel aufgeben werde. Man bekommt hÃ¶herwertiges Material nur in der Verfluchten Zone. Wo man aber mit einer AusrÃ¼stung hingehen muss die bei weitem selbst fÃ¼r den "schwÃ¤chsten" Gegner (eine "verfluchte Ratte" Lvl 15) nie im Leben ausreicht! Also der sogenannte Spielespass ist passÃ©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116022834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 5358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1582999993}
review:
A pesar de un trasfondo sandbox muy bien pensado en cuanto a posibilidades de crafteo, caza, construcciÃ³n... le falta dinamismo, el movimiento es MUY tosco, el personaje se engancha en cualquier sitio y da la sensaciÃ³n de que el personaje y el jugador no se entienden en cuanto a las ordenes, incluso a pesar de la desesperaciÃ³n que puede causar esto si pretendes sacar partido de las mecÃ¡nicas teÃ³ricas de combate, el juego ofrece muchas posibilidades de inmersiÃ³n y algunas sorpresas gratas, no recomendarÃ­a jugarlo en un servidor PvP, no al menos sin comprobar que el movimiento no va a ser un problema.

Probablemente si es la primera vez que ves el juego tengas buenas dudas sobre lo que realmente es, y lo cierto es que hay motivos para tenerlas, podrÃ­a ser del estilo a ARK, tiene posibilidades en varias direcciones, agricultura, crafting, construcciÃ³n... pero no parece haber equilibrio en el apartado dungeon, parece que es un survival/sandbox de aspecto realista, como podrÃ­a ser Xsyon (este Ãºltimo es postapocalÃ­ptico) ambos juegos dan prioridad absoluta al apartado sandbox/survival y dejan el combate casi fuera de lugar, aunque en mi opiniÃ³n xsyon es mucho mas refinado.

En resumen me parece un juego lo suficientemente trabajado para darle un 7 sobre 10, no destaca por sus mecÃ¡nicas pero si por su trasfondo y merece la pena resaltar que estÃ¡ en espaÃ±ol, se puede jugar en solitario o con amigos, mejora con una comunidad pequeÃ±a.

http://aodb.forosactivos.net/f13-el-rincon-del-tester

Conviene decir para los nuevos jugadores que los recursos van apareciendo sobre la faz de la tierra a medida que tus habilidades permiten que puedas usarlos de modo que muchos recursos no serÃ¡s capaz de verlos al inicio haciendo que el terreno pueda parecer algo desolado, de la misma forma muchas recetas requieren aprender sobre ellas gracias a pistas que encontraremos en restos, cuerpos y carros que aparecen aleatoriamente por el mundo, algunas cosas que querremos tener o construir requieren una cantidad de pasos previos que puede llegar a asustar, pero a medida que vamos jugando estas cosas van apareciendo o desbloqueandose de forma paulatina reduciendo la impresiÃ³n inicial de impotencia.

review: So I haven't meet any players in game. I haven't received any bonus things for people who purchased the game. But that's fine for me, since Wild Terra Online is a boring game anyway. Maybe if you are into Rust-like games, but with isometric view, you might actually have some fun with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994726550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1564275361}
review:
Pros:
Not only free but does not require 3rd party account.
Promissing take on the beaten to death survival mechanics.
Cons:
No map! Not even a very rough overview of the world, let alone a minimap.
Implementation of the idea lacking. Still many unpolished rough edges.
Currently not many thing to look for in the endgame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137221041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 21506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21487, 'last_played': 1636254962}
review: Spent more enough time in this game to know that it's definitely not for me. The controls are cumbersome, the movements are clunky, the interactions with the game are of a nagging nature; the cash shop items are, largely, well overpriced. The community is also tiny and it's a C grade game at the very best; that's being very generous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139100755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2411, 'last_played': 1563656772}
review: I did like the fact you can build your housing in open world however you need certain items that are very hard to find to keep upgrading and crafting items you need to make suitable armor and weapons. You also can't just learn recipes when you get to the appropriate level you have to find them also almost impossible. If you just want to go in and garden then its a great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198067563194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 3258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3258, 'last_played': 1555482170}
review:
This one is difficult in the sense that it is not a bad game,

You have various skills and attributes that you need to level and advance,
Certain things become visible or accessible the higher the level in that field becomes.

Upgrades and recipes need to be acquired, so you need to continuously hunt down 'Godsends' in the hope the recipes are there [i](The vain hope as are there are higher level players on lightning fast steeds that troll the map for these things)[/i]

It will consume a vast amount of time before you start achieving anything worth while.

And back to the original line, with some drastic alterations and improvements, this game can be a great deal better.
Still playable after a while, however I don't see myself going back to this game.

Recommended : Yes
Replayability : Yes
Drawbacks : Very, very time demanding

-Universal Gamer

author: {'steamid': '76561198010019590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 7624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5538, 'last_played': 1564603078}
review:
Gameplay is clunky, laggy, and obtuse. Developers did not get a spectacular English translation. Game store lockbox mechanism is considered gambling in some jurisdictions, which means the developers frequently target children players for gambling purchases, which is questionable. 

Although I do like the world building mechanic which allows players to make changes to the world, it seems like players are intended to be confined to only their own little area, and changes outside that area are temporary. There's essentially no community to speak of, and the game isn't intended to be completed solo. Even getting a group together to hunt bears is extremely problematic and this problem of community building is compounded by the extreme difficulty of getting viable gear outside of pay-to-win.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044808951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1800, 'last_played': 1589191012}
review: Este juego es maravilloso. Empiezas de cero recogiendo algunas piedras y palos y a partir de ahÃ­ te las tienes que ir apaÃ±ando para conseguir lo necesario para ir sobreviviendo, construir y mejorar tu refugio, aprender recetas cuyos trozos iras recogiendo de las exploraciones y un montÃ³n de cosas que te tocarÃ¡ ir haciendo y aprendiendo sobre la marcha. Requiere tiempo y paciencia, pero poco a poco se va avanzando. No hay mapa ni minimapa, y espero de verdad, que nunca lo incluyan, asÃ­ es la supervivencia, aprender a reconocer el terreno por donde te mueves. Hay otra queja bastante habitual aparte de la del mapa, que es la de que no hay mucha gente, pero no se si se llega a comprender que esto es beneficioso, mas recursos a tu disponibilidad, mas bendiciones, mas espacio disponible para tu refugio... mas de todo para ti, todo beneficios. Este juego es para disfrutarle y para entenderle con tiempo y paciencia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016686103', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1557536813}
review:
This game is so retarded.
You will not meet anyone before you get completely bored of it. The controls lag, its impossible to hit moving targets with range attacks, there is only one speed despite the 'running' abliity, so you're forced to walk the entire game. The game is SLOW and BO-RING.

You can try to attack a single baby boar with an axe though, and get mauled to death. Pretty sure that would never happen in real life. Best boar assrape simulator 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025408267', 'num_games_owned': 911, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1588607138}
review:
Not a bad game but very slow to progress.  Like today making copper nails it takes 5 minutes to make 1.  That is too slow in my opinion.  If you can put up with the slowness its not too bad but I prefer games like Ultima Online and will continue to play that.  If crafting was made quicker in this game then it would be on to a winner but 5 minutes to make 1 nail come on you are having a laugh

I would change to recommend if crafting was made quicker.

review: This game could of been so much more, but in the recent weeks they have TURNED the game into FREE to play and filled it with micro transactions. because no in their right mind wants to pay 10 or 20 dollars to play this game on a PVP server and get harassed to no end where they can't even progress to fight back. Support will do nothing to stop the HIGH level players from attacking ANY new player period, I have reported on this and supplied screen shots of my self and other players chat log showing of the harassment. They claim they don't allow name calling / verbal harassment I have REPORTED many times on this and provide screenshots and still nothing is done, I have witnessed players screaming at each other and provided screen shots and STILL nothing is DONE. The Dev's lie and provide ZERO SUPPORT. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME TO ANYONE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202313213', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15495, 'last_played': 1563123839}
review:
Some conclusions after 350 hours of gameplay.
Gameplay ? Meh.
-At first it was really enjoyable. Especially if you have a history of Ultime Online. You can get that air.
-Game doesn't have any proper endgame content. And there isn't any new content for a looong time. That's why the game gets boring quickly.
 -If you are solo player, then PVE is not for you. Even if you have friends to play with, you need good gear to do PVE. And believe me, it takes ages to get or craft good items.
-Fps and Lag issues.

Beginner Friendly ? Hell no.
-All of the game's old forum topics and answers have been deleted. And there is no proper information in the forums of the Steam. If you ask something in the game's Steam page, you have to wait a week for the developers to respond. Also the game's wikipedia page is completely garbage.

Although you have chosen to give the game a chance, the break point in the game is the iron mine. To improve your skills, builds, crafting, or steel, in short, iron is needed for everything. You need thousands of iron to improve your skills and make good items. Iron respawn times are very long and everyone is constantly looking for iron on the map.

review:
Tienes cosas positivas, es bueno si. Pero Â¿microtransacciones en un early acess? Â¿ en serio?, la evoluciÃ³n es lenta requiere muchas horas de juego que la mayorÃ­a de jugadores no soportan y terminan abandonandolo rapidamente.

bueno igual
Pros:
- extenso sistema de craft y artesanias

Contras:

author: {'steamid': '76561198117132995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 4150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4149, 'last_played': 1551630390}
review:
I think I have enough time in this game to make a fair review at this point.

If you enjoy crafting games this may be a game you should try out, it will keep you busy for hours on end. 
The combat is basic but for me that is actually appealing; Combat animations are informative but simple.
There is a cash shop {of course there is} from what I can tell it is advantageous to put real life money in but it does not hit the p2w border. In game purchases can vary from premium status which boosts xp gained and lowers crafting times, mounts that the player cannot lose upon death and various cosmetics. It should be noted you can actually acquire premium items, including premium status from looting in game 'Godsends' 
Godsends are the Wild Terra's randomly spawned lootables that can rewards crafting or combat items as well as recipes to craft and learn and the aforementioned premium items.

I play on the EU server so I can only speak with experience for that server but the community seems decent. PvP is always enabled yet I have managed to keep my life and items safe from others so far. I was offered multiple guild invites when I announced I was new and everyone I have spoken to is keen to help with learning the game. 

The base building mechanics in this game are quite nice, mixed with the multitude of options on things to build and skills to increase you will find yourself designing your perfect home and farm lands. One criticism I have here is that buildings and furnishings typically have two faces, instead of four, meaning it can be tricky to lay structures out exactly how you would like. 

TLDR: Runescape and Rust had a love affair and this is their shame baby, 
          Ultima Online players rejoice! It's not quite Britain but it'll do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376479253', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 4178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4178, 'last_played': 1551217616}
review:
Pros:

>Free-to-play.
>Generally authentic medieval historical elements & setting.
>Above average top down elements.
>Above average RPG elements.

Cons:

>Game itself suffers from memory leaks which can cause lagging & freezing.
>Very repetitive as you have to grind to make progress in terms of building, crafting, etc.
>Very small player base with an average of less than 200 players.
>Graphics feels & looks dated.
>Very limited enemy/animal variety, as most are just resized with a different level.
>Very repetitive terrain.
>Some pay-to-win elements.
>Game can have more guides & tutorials.
>Community is unwelcoming to new players.

It was very fun at the start but after awhile you see that the game is just one huge grind.
If it was not for the huge grind & repetitiveness the game would have been better.

Overall I give it a 4.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031300721', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3466, 'last_played': 1550938992}
review:
This could have been a great game, but it's absolutely not worth playing due to the illogical design choices that turned this game into a grind fest combined with RNG crafting system. 

To make it easy to understand, to make a piece of copper armor that requires level 14 blacksmithing, you need to build a spinning wheel that requires level 25 carpentry, which is made using bronze nails that require level 15 blacksmithing, from bronze ingots that requires level 20 mining.

In short, to make something from one crafting skill, you need to have higher level in OTHER skills before you even begin. Sure, you can craft at lower skill level, but at a abysmally low chance. 

It was fun at the first 30 minutes, but then it's the same thing on repeat over and over again. Once you reached certain point, you might as well spend hours and hours into the game only to make zero progress due to the RNG chance in the crafting system. 

I'm a fan of RPG games, and played this game with my friend who is a sucker for survival/sanbox games. This games at first glance, should be able to satisfy both of us. Sadly, we both agreed to drop it after 2-3 days of toiling around, only to make almost no progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310849978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7203, 'last_played': 1555569565}
review:
PuntuaciÃ³n = 7/10
ValoraciÃ³n = Buena
Experiencia con la Comunidad = Excelente
Tipo de Avance= Lento 

Crafteo = Malo
Me parece un juego con mucho potencial es un gran mundo abierto pero muchas cosas requieren explicaciones y busquedas en la wiki el sistema de crafteo no me ha gustado del todo me gustaria que estubiera en sistema crafteo tipo minecraft ademas el desarrollo de algunas extructuras requiere un menu especializado para el crafteno  ya que suele ser un poco engorroso buscarlo en una lista .

Mundo = Bueno 
El mundo me parece una de las cosas buenas ya que constantemente hay nuevas cosas lo unico que no me gusta es el sistema de referencia debio ser explicado ya que las ubicaciones puedes guardarla un submenu algo escondido para mi donde pues puedes guardar ubicaciones  por cierto numero limitado y este numero aumenta mientras mas aumentamos esa profesiÃ³n  hay un icono que indica cual es la posiciÃ³n de la casa para que sepas a donde tienes que ir eso me gusta mucho para no perderse. tambien existe un sistema de regalos mientras exploras donde encuentras nuevas recetas, items, etc. La verdad para aprovechar todo esto debes conseguir las monturas las puedes buscar en el sistema de subasta o adiestrando una montura ( Necesitas lv de profesiÃ³n para hacerlo con exito )

Sistema de Comercio = Bueno (Tipo primitivo)
Bueno el sistema de comercio principalmente consiste en unas subastas donde podrÃ¡s vender los artÃ­culos que tengas a la venta , para vender Necesitas una tienda y para comprar Necesitas una tablon de subastas este te cobrara una comisiÃ³n aunque tambien te seÃ±alara la casa de quien lo venda para que vallas a compro sin comision  (Problema puede que este en la zona cerrada del jugador) aunque si ves una tienda puedes comprar directamante solo que el tablon de subastas puedes ver todo lo que esta en el mundo a la venta. Otra cosa que hay que hablar es la moneda que se usa en el juego las mas usadas son las Especias (Sal, Pimienta, Etc. Se obtiene de los cofres y bendiciones  ) , Polvo de hueso ( Se obtiene moliendo hueso aunque no es tan valioso ) , Lingote de Hiero o Acero la moneda mas cara que he visto , aunque hay mas materiales costosos no a la venta 

Comunidad = Excelente
Una de las cosas que me sorprendiÃ³ fue la comunidad activa de este juego mas la del servidor de norte america pvp para explicar esto tengo que contar una historia donde estaba creando una base con mi hermano ya habiamos hecho muchas cosas asi que decidimos mudarnos de base donde en eso jugador salvaje ( por lo general si ves otro jugador saludas preguntas y luego te vas no robas) esto jugador decidiÃ³ robarnos  y matarnos rompiendo todo lo que encontraba bueno el pvp de este juego es algo primitivo y el tenia algo que lo hacia mas veloz bueno al final nos robo muchas cosas y se fue en eso decidimos usar el chat y bueno los jugadores activos tienen una especie de comunidad donde el robo esta penado con la muerte y la destrucciÃ³n de la base del agresor si es encontrada para la segunda ves que vino la amenaza fue eliminda y su base destruida por los jugadores mas veteranos ellos se toman eso muy en serio ya que las construcciones algunas son muy caras de hacer ( ojo puedes encerrar un jugador que entre en tu casa si cierras la puerta y su arma no puede destruir tus murallas ) desde ese dia conosco y saludo a los jugadores mas veteranos del juego .

Sistema de batalla = Regular 
Bueno les explico en este juego tiene habilidades que obtienes al subir cierto nivel de esa habilidad y hay un monton de ellas , problema ? bueno no se explica hasta que explores bien el menu del personaje en la "k" cual es el problema no se explica que las tienes asta que busques o la entres de manera casual 

Resumen 
Este juego todavÃ­a esta en una versiÃ³n beta mejorable con el tiempo, este juego puede ser disfrutable para jugadores veteranos que les gusta este genero y no le importe los graficos y se tome todo con paciencia e inteligencia

author: {'steamid': '76561198065457409', 'num_games_owned': 2925, 'num_reviews': 593, 'playtime_forever': 11392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11335, 'last_played': 1692533971}
review:
NOT WORTH BUYING/PLAYING!

First of all this game is good, its a simple grinding browsergame-port with a way to intense shop need!
It focus on the grinding and ONLY on the grinding, you do nothing than collect things to make something to store more ressources and go grinding again. All you can do, you will see in the first 30 min, after this it is only grinding to get upgrades. well some diffrent ressources but not a change on the gameplay. the real problem is that the game is nearly unplayble in the mid- to late-game because than grinding is so intense if you dont have premium and insight... not even china-farmer would play it!

For example: you need to mine iron and need 9.000 XP for the next level, with premium and insight (login bonus) around 350 XP, if you dont have insight you only got 40 XP and without that 20 XP, simple said, you will ride around the whole day without premium and insight to get the same XP as you make in around 40 min with the login bonus and to give it the cake, you need hours to make enough ore for a simple thing. and if this wouldn't be enough it only spawns in a few less areas which are absolute overrun with other players, so making a few louse nails will take hours...besides you fasten things up with premium shop items

author: {'steamid': '76561197969952464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1550217632}
review:
What can I say that those playing this won't already know. 

The game is very reminiscent of Ultima Online - the first MMO that ruined my younger education from a standard academic point of view, but actually enhanced my programming skills when I learnt how to macro.. 

But, Ultima Online is now very dated and feels clunky. This is where I appreciate Wild Terra. If you can get over the jittery scrolling, the game is surprisingly deep and well thought through.

My ONE critique.. albeit one, very critical critique.

This game should be called f***ing WOLF TERROR, not Wild Terra. 

If a wolf kills you, don't try and get your shit back. Those things are, and as expected, ferocious furry bastards with an aggro range like an absolute beast and a penchant for killing noobs clad in the complementary Christmas furrs carrying a wooden shovel.

Oh, and on my first purchase of a 'lock-box-esque' item, I received a 'rare' mount. A rat with blood round it's mouth. NICE!

Play it, you'll enjoy it. But you'll agree with me quickly. FUCK WOLVES!

author: {'steamid': '76561198389324533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1836, 'last_played': 1572294026}
review:
Bom, vamos falar um pouco sobre o conteÃºdo e potencial do jogo!

Antes de tudo, essa conta minha na steam tem apenas 27 horas de jogo, no entanto tenho a minha conta principal que jogo pelo client do jogo que conta com umas 900 horas, acredito q jÃ¡ tenha passado disso.

O jogo funciona todo em torno do farm e craft, ele conta com um sistema pratico e fÃ¡cil de se acostumar, tem uma grande quantidade de itens que podem ser forjados com materiais bÃ¡sicos.
Tem uma grande variedade de construÃ§Ãµes, fornos, estÃ¡bulos, forjas, ferrarias entre outras coisas mais, existe tbm uma grande variedade de comidas, grande maioria delas lhe fornece algum status bÃ´nus alem de alimentar seu personagem, isso Ã© apenas o bÃ¡sico que o jogo oferece. Poderia passar horas falando sobre diferentes sistemas entre outras coisas existentes no Wild Terra, acredito que de comeÃ§o isso seja o principal para se saber sobre o jogo.

Acredito que algumas dicas podem facilitar e muito o comeÃ§o de muitos aqui, entao vou dividir elas em pve e pvp!

PVE: Primeiro de tudo, vÃ¡ na sua aba de atributos e leia o que cada um faz, pois voce tem 33 pontos que podem ser distribuÃ­dos entre 5 atributos diferentes, sÃ£o eles que vÃ£o determinar seu tipo de jogo, se ai ser um personagem com muita vida e forÃ§a, ou entÃ£o um arqueiro Ã¡gil e rÃ¡pido com pontos em destreza e percepÃ§Ã£o, ou entÃ£o um crafter com uma inteligencia alta e algum outro atributo que vocÃª acredita ser Ãºtil para seu personagem. Uma coisa, o mÃ¡ximo que um atributo pode ter naturalmente Ã© 12 pontos.
Procure por espÃ³lios pelo mapa, geralmente eles podem conter, equipamentos bÃ¡sicos. receitas de itens, comidas, ferramentas, e atÃ© mesmo uma montaria. Se for fazer crafter, foque em upar skills como ferraria, couraria, trabalho com pedras, coleta entre outras skill relacionadas a craft.

PVP: Primeiro de tudo, vÃ¡ na sua aba de atributos e leia o que cada um faz, pois vocÃª tem 33 pontos que podem ser distribuÃ­dos entre 5 atributos diferentes, sÃ£o eles que vÃ£o determinar seu tipo de jogo, aqui tem um pequeno porem, o jogo conta com maÃ§a, arco, lanÃ§a, faca, machado e espada, cada uma dessas armas combina com um determinado atributo. seja forÃ§a para maÃ§a ou entÃ£o a percepÃ§Ã£o para o arco, vocÃª tem que ficar bem atento no que vai desejar usar como arma ao longo da sua jornada. Entrou no jogo, vÃ¡ upar suas skills de combate imediatamente, gaste todo seu foco de batalha, ter skill de batalha faz uma grande diferenÃ§a, isso que vai determinar se vai sair vivo ou nÃ£o, quando se encontrar com algum outro player, sempre mate animais com 10lvs menor que o seu ou entÃ£o 10lvs maior que o seu, essa Ã© a faixa de lvs que vocÃª vai ganhar xp. 

SÃ£o dicas bem bÃ¡sicas, porem que vÃ£o fazer uma grande diferenÃ§a no seu inicio de jogo, alguns pontos, a grande maioria dos players vÃ£o atacar quando verem vocÃª no mapa, afinal Ã© um servidor pvp. porem nada impede de fazer amizades e entrar em uma guild. Enfim, o jogo Ã© legal e divertido, basta se dedicar um pouco que vocÃª consegue chegar em um ponto que vai ter uma guild para fazer um conteÃºdo diferente dentro do jogo, seja ir nas terras corrompidas matar chefes ou entÃ£o caÃ§ar tesouros  para conseguir recompensas Ã³timas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132064375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1525060785}
review: Vejo um grande potencial neste jogo, porÃ©m ainda nÃ£o alcanÃ§ou o que considero importante para um bom MMO, os players fiÃ©is. Ã‰ muito normal vocÃª encontrar no jogo "terrenos" abandonados, o que por um lado Ã© bom, onde vc pode saquear sem penalidades, mas nÃ£o tÃ£o interessante pois vocÃª percebe que muitos players iniciam suas aventuras e nÃ£o avanÃ§am, muito provavelmente pq nÃ£o se empolgaram com o jogo. Quando comprei, tive a expectativa de ser algo semelhante Ã  Ultima Online, mas nÃ£o chegou perto de ser isso, nem sequer parece ter tentado. Vejo que Wild Terra Ã© um tanto monÃ³tono, com poucos desafios e pouca dinÃ¢mica. Mas recomendo ele pois vejo uma grande margem para melhorias, e talvez um dia possa se aproximar de UO (se esta for a intenÃ§Ã£o dos desenvolvedores). Para quem nÃ£o conhece Ultima Online, este  game foi um dos pioneiros no universo MMO. Segue a sÃ©rie de jogos com nome Ultima, das dÃ©cadas de 80 e 90, que na segunda metade dos anos 90 lanÃ§ou seu modelo de jogo online. Na minha opiniÃ£o ainda nÃ£o foi superado por nenhum outro atÃ© hoje, mesmo que muitos copiaram seu modelo, com aprimoramento grÃ¡fico sem igual, o jogo em si, enredo, desenvolvimento e dinÃ¢mica bem amarrada, nÃ£o foi superado.

review:
EntÃ£o galera, o jogo Ã© bom mas tem alguns graves problemas que sÃ£o os seguintes:

1 - Se vocÃª planeja jogar sozinho, esqueÃ§a. Esse jogo foi feito pra jogar em guilds jÃ¡ que seu personagem vai ter crafting limitado e vocÃª vai craftar uma coisa especifica, te forÃ§ando a criar um mercado com outros players.

2 - O PvP Ã© desbalanceado, se vocÃª entrar num server, acabar seu tempo de jogador novato e topar com um jogador veterano  ele vai te matar instantaneamente e pegar todas as suas coisas. AlÃ©m de que ele pode estar em grupo, nesse caso sua chance de fuga Ã© zero.

3 - O Grinding desse jogo Ã© extremamente repetitivo, e mais pra frente te leva a ter que competir com outros jogadores pelos recursos, o que leva os novatos a nÃ£o conseguirem progredir em servers com guildas dominantes.

4 - A pesar do jogo ser pago ele tem uma loja de produtos P2W, de acordo com os desenvolvedores o jogo nÃ£o Ã© P2W, mas eu nunca vi um jogo que vende montaria infinita, XP, Recipes e equipamentos nÃ£o ser P2W, Ã© pura mentira.

5 - Pelo que eu saiba nÃ£o existem servers brasileiros a pesar do lag nÃ£o ser um problema, mas se encontrar com outros brasileiros Ã© bem difÃ­cil, o que leva os gringos a ter uma grande vantagem, a nÃ£o ser que vocÃª saiba inglÃªs como eu.

6 - Se vocÃª ficar muito tempo sem jogar sua base EVAPORA, e foi isso o que me levou a parar de jogar, fiquei dias e dias construindo minha base atÃ© um dia em que a tela do meu notebook rachou, e atÃ© a nova chegar minha base sumiu, e quando eu respawnei eu estava preso entre um rio e a base de outra pessoa que construiu por cima da minha, ou seja, perdi todos os meus itens como consequÃªncia.

review: I love any crafting sandbox MMO style games (basically in the Ultima Online format). This game scratches that itch perfectly. I am a care bear PVE player, so cant say much about combat. I prefer to craft and build in these games usually! And that part of the game is awesome. Will update the review if it changes with more hours!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107888561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 3946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1621, 'last_played': 1575756787}
review:
Despues de jugar 13 horas al juego me cuesta un poco valorarlo aÃºn, ya que tiene cosas buenas y malas.
Dejando aparte el apartado grafico que es el que muestra el juego y al que no le doy mÃ¡s importancia... me queda la sensaciÃ³n de que es un buen juego con mucho contenido con una idea y concepto que estÃ¡ muy bien... pero a la par... me fastidia porque no se ve que estÃ© terminado y no tiene la comunidad de jugadores detrÃ¡s que se merecerÃ­a para funcionar... entonces te queda una sensaciÃ³n como de vacio... con muchas cosas para poder desarrollar pero no sabes exactamente para que... Si, es cierto, dispone de multijugador, de mundo abierto entre comillas porque en realidad si, es un mundo muy grande pero sin referencias, es decir, no hay historia, no hay misiones, no hay ciudades principales... asÃ­ que los unicos objetivos que veo son... crearte una casa, recolectar, plantar, buscar lugares donde te dan recetas para seguir mejorando objetos, cazar... pero... Â¿cual es el objetivo? SÃ© que me queda mucho por explorar, he visto cosas que aÃºn desconozco... quiero pensar que hay mucho mÃ¡s... pero hasta donde he llegado... no veo mÃ¡s... 
Musica repetitiva, pocos efectos de sonidos, practicamente nadie al menos en el servidor que escogÃ­, pocos servidores a la misma vez, graficos mejorables, que pusieran una tienda de compra de objeto me parece fatal porque no creo que sea un juego barato... asÃ­ que no sÃ© que pensar aÃºn. 
Quiero pensar que el juego solo tiene un aÃ±o, que estÃ¡ en beta y que mejorarÃ¡... le darÃ© un 5/10 espero no tener que bajar la puntuaciÃ³n en un futuro y ponerle negativo.
En Gnu-Linux va perfecto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003840422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1640405307}
review: This is a pretty decent game, honestly.  I love the old school graphics, and the isometric perspective.  I would enjoy it much more if it was single player, or had private servers, simply because then I wouldn't have a bunch of other player constructions in my way all the time.  I've never seen another player in this game, and I don't know if it's going to last as it seems like no one is playing, which is another reason private server software would be a good idea.  I understand the developers want the game to be played together in a community, but I just don't see that community, anywhere in the game.  At any rate, it's a good game and doesn't cost much money.  There are, unfortunately, p2w microtransactions in the game, which is extremely lame, but I've had no problem playing it without feeling stifled having not bought anything from the microtransaction shop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120927068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 14712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4799, 'last_played': 1549170283}
review:
Aunque con unos grÃ¡ficos muy sencillos, el juego es muy pero que muy adictivo. 
Juego mmo de supervivencia, con toques de rol en un mundo abierto. Un juego difÃ­cil, en el que cuesta progresar y hay que dedicarle muchas horas si quieres avanzar. 
Las Ãºnicas cosas que no me gustan mucho, son que hay muy pocos servidores a escoger y por tanto todos estan muy avanzados ya. Por lo que si entras en uno pvp, es muy complicado. La otra es que hay bastante "pay to win", que asÃ­ como en pve no afecta tanto, en pvp sÃ­. 
Yo estoy en el server en pruebas, que es como "mixto". En general el mapa es pve y no te pueden matar, pero hay unas zonas especificas donde si se puede matar jugadores. Y la verdad, estÃ¡ genial este formato. Puedes jugar tranquilo, sin que un pay to win te rebiente todo, y si quieres pelea, puedes ir a esas zonas. 
En fin, si os gusta este tipo de juegos de supervivencia, os lo recomiendo totalmente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002593655', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3984, 'last_played': 1540509597}
review:
A big f***ing waste of time. 
- No map and no tracking. 
- If you die before you reach your corpse, you also f***ed. 
- You need to glitch animals to hunt, otherwise it takes too much time to chase and kill them. 
- Skill gain is also so slow if you didn't pay for boosters.
- You may wake up with a level 63 bear in your house which one shots you and makes your home a place of hell.
- Many bugs including easy access to other people's chests.
and so on.

Just do not waste your time and money on this deepsh*t survival my *ss.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984415204', 'num_games_owned': 1219, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 2304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1895, 'last_played': 1539530953}
review:
This game is actually a 2D browser based game with a premium shop.
Cons:
- Clunky and invonvinient GUI
- Absense of a map
- Absense of a minimap or a radar
- Very small field of view
- Very small map
- No points of interest or landmarks on a map
- Very low population
- No territorial progression
- Slot-based limited inventory
- Pay to ease the grind
- Pay to win
- Laggy
- Some bugs
