author: {'steamid': '76561197984719846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 33392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23810, 'last_played': 1549982838}
review:
So I have 398 recorded hours of gameplay as of this writing.  I've been part of a guild on the Ventar server for most of those hours.  Been involved in plenty of PvP, Castle Sieges, and PvE excursions.  Done plenty of treasure hunting as well.

I have played a great deal of other games out there as I have been gaming since I was very young.  I have played UO, EQ, EQ2, DAoC, ESO, SoTA, LoA, WoW, ... you get the point.  I like to game.

If you have played other games out there and then jump in to play this you are going to first think and say "W T F is this...".  I personally think the game is fun for a little while, but as time goes on you start to feel like you are playing a pointless game.  Some can say this is how most games are now-a-days, but this one got to this point faster than most others.

I'm going to bullet point the good and bad that I can think of off the top of my head:

Good:
- Lots of stuff to craft and pretty diverse ability to craft.
- Really neat how you can "claim" land and make it your own.
- Low PC requirements
- Can even play on a web browser (which is pretty neat)

Bad:
- No way to get better recipes for crafting unless you get lucky and loot it.
- The looting of recipes from "Godsends" is totally random and most of the time  you get TONS of duplicates.
- Even if you try to BUY more recipes... you still end up getting useless crap.
- PvE is terrible.  Like really terrible.
- No real ability to heal on the spot (bandages, etc...) - must run constantly from mobs to wait for AI to stopp aggro - then sit to heal.
- Ingame sounds lag behind the actions you do - this has been constant for the entire 398 hrs of my gameplay
- Combat is clunky and pretty dull.

.... Stopping here for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118688259', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 16032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14259, 'last_played': 1558850183}
review:
most of the better posed players dont seem to p2win here
at this point i could go and solo the 3 big bears (very material expensive)
as a light armored archer if i had the skills to skin them properly and build the biggest dominium
so if you like earning your stuff in game with your own hands dont get scared away from the 
people complaining here about p2win
most of them have played this just a handful of hours
a few of such i even met ingame and they were acting like beggars
or grief around destroying/looting whatever is possible while theres no profit for them in it
its on sale now and definitely worth 5bucks to give it a try

btw. animals and corruption are hard enough
dont just start on a PVP server solo without full knowledge of the game and blueprnts free for all server and expect this game to be played this way
start anew on a pvp server or pay for the takeover with a couple of friends you made on a pve server when you know what you`re doing

but beware of bears! those motherfuckers are fast as sonic and strong as hulk

just farm godsends and don't go too far away from your home ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198260506501', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1706071994}
review:
The reviews for this game aren't really great, but a lot of them dont really show the full explanation of the game. 
This game is an open world survival game. While some aspects are like an RPG, and it has quite a bit of combat aspects, it is fundamentally, a survival game. I have played the game for 12 hours now, and i have to say, it's pretty great:

Pros:
1: Great Survival Realism. 
2: Multiple Servers the play on to expend your knowledge on PvE, PvE, and Legacy Alpha Servers.
3: Great playerbase: Easy to find help in the international chat. Many guilds to join for fighting, or just surviving in general.
4: Easy to get into. The tutorial missions provide a GREAT base to start off with. Teaches you how to hunt, craft, and make your own fort to pretect yourself. 

Cons:
1: VERY PUNISHING. If you die far from your dominum, or you can get to your death point within thirty minutes, your valuables are lost forever
2: Movement is quite buggy. Not as fluent running and walking as i am used to
3: Buffs are a little buggy. I am miles away from my house, and i still am getting the anvil buff for crafting
4: Mobs are NASTY. If you come across a wolf, bear, or fox as a new player, you will die. (And they are pretty much everywhere)

In total, I think this game is worth buying, if you like hardcore survival in an early 2000s rpg style. If you are looking for an action RPG, fuck the hell off this game is not for you

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017661041', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2384, 'last_played': 1540152749}
review: Still relatively new to the game, but I'm actually quite enjoying it. I can understand people being turned off from it and not enjoying the game within their first few or even 20 hours. It's not a forgiving game and it is quite difficult to get yourself established. Once you get over that hump and find your place, the game becomes addicting. It's different... It doesn't hold your hand and while I usually like a more casual game, this one has a certain intrigue that keeps me wanting to play. I'm not an advanced player... I still have far to go, but I'm enjoying it so far. I just wish more of my friends would give it a chance. Group play will definitely have it's advantages.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043866899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1682, 'last_played': 1661056535}
review:
LÃ¡ vamos nÃ³s: Wild terra Ã© um jogo de sobrevivencia bem simples para os padrÃµes atuais, mas isso Ã± desqualifica a qualidade do game, na verdade Ã© um jogo bem tranquilo de se jogar, nÃ£o Ã© extressante e da pra relaxa. EntÃ£o vou falar sobre pontos positivos e negativos do game:

Positivos: Ã© simples, roda em qualquer PC (ou quase).
1)Existe uma boa variedade de itens para ser criados, o que Ã© excelente. Isso vai de muros de madeira atÃ© fortalezas medievais, o mesmo vale para armaduras e armas de combate e caÃ§a. Do simples ao o mais complexo.
2)VocÃª pode fabricar qualquer item sem a necessidade de por cash, claro que, quanto  melhor o item, mas raro Ã© o matÃ©rial que vc precisa.
3)O jogo tem sistema de atributos automÃ¡tico, ou seja, ele upa conforme vc vai usar as habilidas, exemplo: pra ganhar habilidades de combate, vc precisa lutar com espadas, arcos ou lanÃ§as; pra ser experiente em craficar alguns item de madeira, metal, cobre, bronze etc, vc precisa fabricar esses itens, do mais simples atÃ© pegar nivel pra fabriar os mais complexos.
Qual a vantagem disso? bom, vc n precisa ficar priorizando habilidades ou "mÃ¡gias", ficam montando build e torcer pra ela n dar errado e vc ter que excluir o personagem e comeÃ§ar do zero.
4)Vc pode domesticar qualquer animal, desde um javali ao um urso marrom, e usa-los como montaria.

Negativos: 1)O jogo Ã© MUITO lento (por isso disse que ele relaxa), vc n vai ficar puto com muitos players querendo te matar ou destruindo seu progresso (por que n tem tantos jogadores), ou com monstros super agressivos e fortes te matando toda hora. E pq isso Ã© ruim? porque chega uma hora que o jogo fica chato sem aÃ§Ã£o, vc basicamente foca em farmar e construir seus dominions, nada mais. 
2)VocÃª vai nÃ£o encontrar monstros ou tribos inimigas (de npc) pra vc lutar e ganhar experiencia com armas, ou drogar algum item, o que faz o jogo parecer um the sims medieval.
3)Existem poucas variedades de criaturas, seja pra ser caÃ§adas ou pra vc matar quando estiver muito forte, deixando o jogo, mais uma vez, repetitivo e enjoativo.
4)NÃ£o existe um sistema de pot, onde vc pode recuperar mana e hp enquantno luta com criaturas, o que faz a maior falta em um mmoRPG de sobrevivencia, jÃ¡ que os monstros sÃ£o bem fortes.
5)HÃ¡ poucos jogadores, o que te deixar meio carente no jogo, pois vc precisa tirar duvidas ou pedir ajuda pra obter algum item e n pode, pois sÃ³ hÃ¡ vc e mais 3 gringos em um mapa gigante
6)A camera Ã© travada e isso n seria um problema se vc pudesse movimentar o angulo da mesma. Ã‰ horrivel vc precisar pegar algum item atrÃ¡s de um muro, ou esfolar algum animal e n conseguir pq  a camera n gira, fica sempre naquela posiÃ§Ã£o.
7)NÃ£o hÃ¡ um mini mapa para vc se orientar no jogo, sabe por onde vc passou e marcar onde tem recursos qe vc vÃ¡ precisar no futuro. Isso se torna um problema pq o mapa Ã© gigante, vc precisa decorar o mapa inteiro, usar seu abrigo como orientaÃ§Ã£o.

Sei que parece mais erros do que acertos, mas o jogo Ã© bom de se jogar, sÃ³ falta jogadores pra deixar tudo muito mais legal.

Obs: NÃ£o sei se vale 30 reais, entÃ£o se forem comprar, comprem na promoÃ§Ã£o como eu fiz, que vale muito mais apena.

Obs2: espero que os podrutores do jogo leam isso e acrescentem um mini mapa e uma possivel mutaÃ§Ã£o do angulo da camera para facilitar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103208782', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3120, 'last_played': 1620101172}
review:
Um exelÃªnte jogo de sobrevivencia e crafts, bastante coisa pra fazer, evoluÃ§Ã£o do personagem.
Ainda tenho muita coisa pra aprender a jogar, mas das horas que jÃ¡ estive me impressionei bastante com o pve do jogo.
Esperaria que houvesse mais aprimoramentos quanto aos estilos do personagem e ciclo de dia e noite, e tambÃ©m alguma interaÃ§Ã£o com a Ã¡gua. 
Lembra bastante "ultima", sÃ³ que muito mais evoluido, um bom sandbox pra passar diversas horas jogando, muito itens e tambÃ©m detalhes para fabricar tudo na Ã©poca medieval que o jogo simula.
Recomendo

author: {'steamid': '76561198053216700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1530798917}
review:
Little niche game. I bought it hoping it to be just a chill and grindy game. Unfortunately, the devs decided to literally force group play. At the start u'll find boars and bears which seem to be made impossible to solo. U need bear hide for many starter stuff, which makes growing pointless.

All in all, a game with a chance to be nice.. But screwed up by the devs forcing group play. Waste of money, pity.

review: Es un juego que a simple vista, genera una buena espectativa, lo juegas te entretienes por buen tiempo, pero es muy monotono, aunque a mejorardo bastante, debe mejorar las reclamaciones de territorio, el spawn por que si dejas de jugar dos dias terminas sin nada te saquean sin piedad, no recomendaria para nada este juego, mira otros juegos, pasa por alto este, esta muy crudo, no lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967681101', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4438, 'last_played': 1529447995}
review:
It's a good game, a lot of similar game don't offer the possibility to play with other players, or only on private servers. Here you can join a public server, or host a private one.

Pros :
-Massively Multiplayer !
-Persistant servers
-Lot of building possibilities
-Uncommon leveling system
-Farming system include tree planting
-Realistic crafting system
-PvP and PvE servers
-Physic : Arrows are stopped by trees and object.
-Character animation and object graphics are good

Cons :
-Map texture are bad, miss grass and sand models above it.
-Map in-game with base display on it.
-Miss relief on map
-Miss pathfinfing
-Water is pixelized
-Sound and music are repetitive
-Only 2 possibility of rotation for building
-Can't build diagonal wall and triangle floors
-Max zoom out is limited by a black square
-Miss a research table in order to learn blueprints even if you don't find them.
-Doors are closing instantly, and you need to be to close to the door, you may stay stuck inside the door.

You can build your town on a persistant server.
Of course it will be a bit hard to build everthing, at the beginning it's hard to farm high level ressources. But you begin to earn enough when you begin to craft tools. And after that it will be very easy.

The difficulty is too hard on Casual Servers i think, it would be better with some unlocked blueprints, and the "novice" effet should stay a bit longer. Maybe 12 or 24 hours instead of 8. Farming level for stone and wood may begin at level 10 or 15.

Or maybe need to create a new server category for "noobs" like me ^^ With pvp of course...
Maps should be a lot smaller too, in order to have more chance to find other players, dominium time may be reduced to one or two week after disconnect on these small maps.

review: al principio va un poco lento, y con pocas guias de que camino seguir, pero ya al cabo de un rato ya practicando, metiendose en el mapa, se le toma el gusto y comienza a ser un poco adictivo, ya que hay muchas cosas que hacer, mapas que recorer, animales que cazar, entre muchas otras tareas, que a la larga hacen casi innecesario ese NPC diciento que debes hacer, si se extraÃ±a mucho tener un mini mapa, o alguna forma de marcar territorios para poder guiarse. el juego lo recomiendo muchisimo, porque es barato, tiene graficos decentes, el juego sin crashes ni bug. sin duda tiene un futuro prometedor, solo falta mas gente aportando a mejorar el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973572043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 2163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1532622998}
review:
I "just" bought this and tried it.
Now it is 9 hours later.
It's ok.

Ha ha, no! It is [b]totally[/b] fun.

I played and played and from time to time I did eat. I did not realize how long I had played already.

This is one of the many survival games out there. Why is it good?
[list]
[*] It is easy to see what is happening because of the isometric view. No enemy is killing you from behind without you noticing.
[*] Is is easy to use. There are no tricks or things to know. You start it, you do stuff. The crafting window ("c") tells you most of the things you need to know.
[*] The tutorial is easy to follow and afterwards you can just keep playing. During the tutorial I did not notice any locked content or area.
[*] Everything is just so straight forward. I do google/wiki some things, like duration of field growth or use of saplings, but it is not really needed, you could find out on your own.
[*] You are NOT all the time nearly dying, instead you are having fun.
[/list]

The world is medieval, no science fiction, no magic. I think. At least I did not see anything of that kind in the crafting window.

There are servers with PVP and servers without it (PVE only). I am playing on a PVE server and I am currently happy.

You create knives, axes or or bows from different materials, you get better and better quality, you create your little own area where you put chests to sort your belongings before you start your next gathering of wood or ore or hides or whatever you currently like to gather.

The interface is easy to use, the graphics are good enough, the game is just so good.

I have to say I am (still) playing Ultima Online, so perhaps I am not the average player.
But if you like to create stuff, care for your fields, go hunting for needed food and are just happy there are still lots of things you still don't know about this world/game, then I have to tell you: get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019644426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2730, 'last_played': 1526026185}
review:
This game has entirely broken mechanics that require you to group up with people in order to progress. For example, a bear cannot be killed by a solo player, regardless of how advanced you are. When asking a developer how it's intended, he said you can shoot a bear using a glitch thru water so he can't cross. This is considered an exploit and has even been fixed so they can cross water. None of this would be an issue if the servers were not entirely dead. In 2 weeks playing this game I ran across 3 people in the open world. There is no map, there are no "towns", there are no central locations that herd people together in any way.

The combat and AI feels clunky and gross, making shooting something as simple as a rabbit annoying.

The progression in this game is based on your property, it's size, and the buildings on it. The leveling system is pointless, there are no npcs, there are no quests, there are no objectives. You collect materials to turn them into more materials, that turn into even more materials and eventually you have a pair of gloves that offer 1% more dodge rating than the ones you started with.

Finally, the game is abandoned in such a way that when you have issues with the game, their discord server has about 70 people in it that might take 3 days to reply. When they do reply, it's another player. There are no admins or support in the discord and their forums are just as bad (and mostly non english speaking)

author: {'steamid': '76561198116322634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 5825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3715, 'last_played': 1644757562}
review:
I've won a key in a giveaway, very happy about it as I wanted to try it anyway. So far I like it a lot - but I don't play at a PvP server but on a casual PvE server, so keep that in mind. There is an area for PvP though called the "Disputable Land" where you can't claim land. 

Few people online, but those who were have been friendly and helpful. I enjoy the UO-like system a lot where everything is skill based and you claim land and start building. The intro-tasks/tutorial are perfectly enough to give one a headstart and some ressources and one receives a set of basic tool which do not take damage but disappear after 10 (?) hours when the "newbie" status runs out.

Everything that is otherwise used in the game is player made and has a quality level and degrades with use but buildings/structures can be repaired. A rather large number of basic recipes one already knows at the start but there are broken down waggons and remain of corpses found in the landscape which yield items and recipe fragments for more things to craft from armor, to weapons, to tools and cooking recipes.

The animal AI is nothing fancy but decent: herbivors run away, bears and wolves attack when you get close enough. If you attack something it might run or attack back. If it is badly hurt it will start running no matter what. Got killed by a fox early on but by now (8 hour in) I have taken my revenge and killed a fawn and a boar pup too.

I have a small farm (waiting for crops to become identifyable as I collected wild seeds) which is growing but my attempt at planting an apple orchard failed, the sapling died somehow. Not sure yet why ... 
I saw a horse but can't yet make the snare needed or the lariat. Curious to learn taming and I saw some quite elaborate camp and player villages.

Overall I feel it is a very nice feature mix reminescent of UO, the Salem MMO (minus the PvP FFA and Permadeath, yay!), and Don't Starve (you need to eat or you starve and you spent quite a bit time initially collecting ... carrots). It is a game I'd recommend on the PvE servers if you want to build a town and do some co-op, just hoping that more people start playing as the crafting depth seems to warrant that one specializes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207926809', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1524591877}
review:
---- Please look carefully at some of the recent "positive" reviews. I spotted 3 that have exsactly the same message from new accounts-----

I really, really wanted to like this game. However, the game has some serious technical problems. Whilst walking around sections of the map failed to load and instead present black sections of the screen that cannot be walked through. This effectlively kept me penned inside a tiny area making it impossible to play the game. It seems this problem was reported by others over a year ago and it is still not fixed. I thought I'd give it a go despite the recent negative reveiws and found it to be completely unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235461280', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1575120048}
review: Wild terra es un juego muy hard-core, asi que si eres un jugador casual, no lo recomiendo. Llevo pocas horas, por lo que tal vez mi analisis sea vago o intransigente, pero en lo poco que he visto he notado que el crecimiento de tu personaje es muy lento, osea basicamente debes ir y volver cada rato para construir un dominio decente (debido a que no posees una gran capacidad en tu inventario). Ademas agrego que tiene una tienda (cash-shop) donde te venden formulas, monturas, etc, que te hacen progresar muy rÃ¡pido ademas de ciertos beneficios como no perder tus estructuras si no logeas continuamente en el juego (Ojo yo no sabia eso; solo lo lei en algunas partes del foro), en fin, son cosas que deberÃ­an estar en el tutorial porque uno desconoce las mecÃ¡nicas del juego en cuestiÃ³n. Ademas el hecho de que si mueres, pierdes todo tu inventario, entre otras cosas. Saludos y esperamos con ansias el Wild terra 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474997', 'num_games_owned': 2217, 'num_reviews': 1072, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1520252827}
review:
It's a sandbox MMORPG ,which in most cases are the hype these days, freedom to roam, build and explore as you see fit.  Sometimes there are server issues where the servers are really dead slow making the game very slow paced or unplayable at times, but this is the same thing as disconnects from other games due to overload of players, it shouldn't happen but it does, so nothing unexpected there.

The game isn't really Pay 2 win based, but those elements exists for those players that's interested in seeding their rise to power. As long as your willing to invest the time and effort required to grown better and stronger in the game you will, there is grind like you can expect in any MMO, but nothing major worth mentioning, it's an MMO and the most expensive thing it requires is your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057318507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1520552572}
review:
Not sure if im more gob-smacked at the fact that I gave my time to completed every single starting mission or the fact that I paid $7.00 AUD for this unpopulated bit of rubish. 

I could have easily gone down to the local Bunnings (hardwear store) and purchased some sandpaper and it would have been more entertaining than this.

Disapointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194072966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1675814198}
review: Everything about this game is perfect. very grindy. nice crafting and inventory system. love the combat, loving the idea that you can create practically your own city. liking the immersion. and i freakin love the progression most of all. the ONLY PROBLEM is that its community based and not many people are playing. its still single player viable when online. but quite lonely. so please please please buy and/or spread the word. can be as cheap as 2 bucks on sale days. and if we can possibly have the community grow to be at least 50% bigger than it is now it will be very well populated and will be alot better for pk`s traders and whatnot. if i were to compare this game with others it would be ultima online with minecraft. basically its a survival version of ultima. 10/10 would reccommend. just need moar ppl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023700385', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1566494843}
review:
I paid this game when the discount was on.
I don't know why people don't like this game as I feel immersed in it, tutorial to help you get a little terrain just so in PVP you can protect yourself everyone says it's pay to play or to even go further in the game bullshit I played 3-4 hours and you get fragments of parchements to get new buildings and crafting things. People who plays just to stay at their base shouldn't be even have the right to note this game I explored like an hour far from my home and got lots of fragments of good stuff it's a survival game not an stay still to win ... if you want retarded jumping around like in CoD or Minecraft don't play this game. Here you need strategy,management and patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016549590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1554410220}
review:
Wow, alright. This game is pretty interesting. I definitely can see it being successful, especially as it takes little room so people with older hardware would have no problems running it.

It's most certainly a throwback to much older, much more challenging games in the 90's with its isometric view and crazy difficulty rollercoasters. Fighting animals, for example, for much needed materials is no easy task, but with some stubborn drive and some strategy (possibly patience), you could wing it.

I love that this is a game that has no classes so much as it's very much a enhance yourself by performing actions to gain in skills type game. I was looking at this game before a key became available, so obviously I would continue down the line saying I would have paid the fifteen bucks for it.

TLDR; Hard but gives you feelings of accomplishment, think similar to Ultima games (this is my opinion, so don't rage at me for having one). Some PVE servers, some PVP servers. Community seems okay, too. Build your own home, collect stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304527602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9522, 'last_played': 1534046375}
review: I love this game. Well worth the low price if you like to grind.  I had been looking for something that had an Ultima Online circa 2001-2004 feel to it and this did the trick. I hope to see more players in my non PVP server.  My BF is getting annoyed at my constant desire to play this game and I hardly slept at all this week. In fact this is the first review I've written out of many Steam games I've played.  It would be nice if the devs included some knid of map or mapping system, as that is rather frustrating but not a deal breaker. It would also be cool if there were more slots in your store and you could charge .5 spices or something rather than having to rely on 1 spice units (spice is the in game currency). Sometimes I want to sell something but 1 spice seems a bit steep, esp. for commonly made objects and the fact that spices are (at least for me) proving hard to obtain. One more thing, devs if you're reading, add some more animals, or resourcs to exploit (does kind of get boring), autostack and an option for additional storage on your person (or give special slots for food items). Okay that's a few things, but whatev.  I can't wait to see the interesting development to come. I only wish I'd knew about this game earlier!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989970487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1521979964}
review: Not that great of a game to be honest. I like the look of things, but after an hour or two you realize it's just grinding for the next upgrade. Which would be alright if there was something else to do. Gathering and Building is all you pretty much do in the first couple of hours of the game. Your also in luck if you can find a single soul in the world. Seems there are not a whole lot of people playing, and looking at the steamcharts this seems to be the case. You also have to log in each week, otherwise your dominion is gone. So don't take a vacation or anything longer then a week. or your stuff will be gone. And not to speak of the microtransactions in the game.

review: A lot of fun, I have a Purple chest and a Blue that can have very good items. I thought that I would need to buy a key in the store, but then I found a godsend in the woods and there was this key I WAS VERY SATISFIED WITH THAT, do not have to spend REAL money to be able to open the chests!

author: {'steamid': '76561198384440814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1518843442}
review:
I often die, but I like to gradually move in progress. The game is very fun and friendly community here, which I have not seen in any online game. Developers are also very responsive, they listen to the wishes of the audience and quickly correct problems.
Thanks to this game I have a lot of new friends

author: {'steamid': '76561197981195798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1549955101}
review:
I like grindy games but this one is a little beyond. What is really insane is the amount of, or lack of inventory space you get. I mean really? Make a way to have bags or something.. you want me to grind my way into a game with sych limited space? And having an in game shop that charges another $35.00 for a starter pack???????? Oh and not to mention, I have played for a few hours and found a few iron chests AWESOME oh wait NOT AWESOME since Ill have to BUY iron keys! Yes, talk crap and say they drop on Godsends.. yea I have found several and several had 2 bread on them.. way to go!

Also i saw how you Developers responded to people who had something negative to say.. especially when they were right. 

In short, I wouldnt suggest giving away your $15.00. I wish I had of bought toilet paper with my $15.00 and got the game for free because it most certainly gives me the SH!*s

review: ĞÑ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° ÑƒĞ»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ğ¸ Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ²Ñ€ĞµĞ¼ĞµĞ½ĞµĞ½Ğ½ÑƒÑ Ultima Online

author: {'steamid': '76561198382618400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1518527661}
review:
The game is interesting and worth attention. If you like medieval atmosphere, survival, PVP, crafting and building, this game is for you.
Pros:
+ Plenty of crafting and building items, there is a lot of things
+ Skill system: For each activity we do, we drive a lvl of a given skill, eg by cutting a tree, we enlarge "woodcutting". If we have too low lvl then we will not be able to cut down all the trees. In addition, there is such a thing as "chance", for example cutting a tree, which requires a slightly higher level of lvl skills, we have to say 50% chance to extract it.
+ Skills: In combat, we can use skills such as jumping, before you have to learn them.
+ The world created by users: It is an online game, so everyone has an influence on what will happen on it, many different castles, etc.
Cons:
- Blank map: Sometimes when you walk you will find an empty map and it looks ugly, but it's no wonder if it is an online game.
- A bit stiff fight, but it changes after getting the first skills.
- Sticking lvl skills takes a long time at later levels

author: {'steamid': '76561198119157927', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1573068966}
review:
Dont understand the hate for this game, its a lot of fun.
Bit overpriced on steam but plenty other sites to buy a key. Its very life is fuedal but nowhere near as restricting.
Crafting is quite in depth, combat is tough but fun from what ive seen so far.
Mainly I just wanted to put that i recommend it as I dont get the bad reviews at all, lot of liars and people with pc's that rnt as good as they are saying or connection speed.
Either way a lot of un.

review:
Pontos positivos:
-VocÃª Ã© livre pra fazer oque quiser
-Diversas construÃ§Ãµes e itens para serem criados

Pontos negativos:
-Gameplay enjoativo e maÃ§ante 
-Extremamente dificil de evoluir no jogo
-Sistema de porcentagem quebrado

  - E os que tem em sua maioria sÃ£o babacas(pvp)
-Devs que nÃ£o estÃ£o nem ai para as opiniÃµes

O jogo tem uma ideia muito boa, porem muito mal aplicada, vocÃª realmente pode fazer o que quiser, porem isso se o jogo quiser, pra tudo o jogo usa sistema de porcentagem. AtÃ© para fazer uma maldita massa de pÃ£o, vocÃª aprende a receita, tem 80% de chances de fazer a massa, e quando faz erra umas 4 vezes a massa, perdendo assim TODOS os materiais usados na fabricaÃ§Ã£o. Para evoluir no jogo vocÃª precisa de ferro e pele de urso, o ferro Ã© extremamente dificil de se obter em servidores PvE, devido a desativaÃ§Ã£o das minas de ferro graÃ§as aos jumentos dos desenvolvedores, ja a pele de urso Ã© impossivel se conseguir sozinho, pois vocÃª nÃ£o consegue matar um urso com armadilhas ou na porrada sozinho, e se matar, ainda precisa de um level absurdo para tirar a maldita pele. Se vocÃª reclama com os desenvolvedores do jogo, tudo que eles falam Ã© "jÃ¡ tem jogadores de nivel alto com isso e aquilo", BOM PARA ELES eu te digo, os desenvolvedores estÃ£o cagando, LITERALMENTE CAGANDO, para a opiniÃ£o do jogador. author: {'steamid': '76561198042098958', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1516441218}
review:
Joguei no lanÃ§amento e um pouco nessa semana e posso dizer que o jogo Ã© chato. Os caras tiveram uma boa ideia, mas nÃ£o sabem como trabalhar com ela, Ã© visÃ­vel a falta de conhecimento em jogos dos desenvolvedores e nem estou falando isso pra ofender, Ã© um fato, se vocÃª jogar vai notar isso. 

Falando por partes...

Ponto Positivo
-VÃ¡rios itens pra construir.
-Liberdade para escolher o que quiser ser.
-Tudo traduzido.
-SÃ³... 

Pontos Negativos
-Sistema de construÃ§Ã£o e coleta Ã© uma lastima, tudo tem porcentagem, Ã© irritante. VocÃª se mata pra juntar os recursos e quando vai construir erra e perde tudo, nÃ£o sobra nem o pÃ³ dos itens que vocÃª coletou, nada! VocÃª vai coletar um recurso como argila por exemplo, 20% de chance de conseguir... mano, que tipo de animal nÃ£o consegue pegar argila?! Ta ali no chÃ£o, parada, Ã© sÃ³ pegar! Mas ai vocÃª tenta coletar e nÃ£o consegue, a argila simplesmente some na sua frente, vocÃª gasta energia, seu equipamento quebra e vocÃª fica lÃ¡, parado... sÃ³ com uma tanga de couro cru olhando pro nada. Isso Ã© irritante!!
-O combate Ã© ruim, me lembrou a Ã©poca que eu jogava Diablo 1.
-PVP Ã© uma desgraÃ§a. No lanÃ§amento tinha mais gente e vocÃª simplesmente nÃ£o fazia nada alem de ficar correndo pelado tacando pedra nos caras. Se vocÃª construÃ­a alguma coisa sempre aparecia alguÃ©m pra quebrar tudo e roubar suas coisas. Hoje em dia tem servidor PVE onde o mapa Ã© infestado de bases abandonadas. Raramente vocÃª vai ver alguÃ©m pelo mapa e os chats sÃ£o desertos.
-Trilha sonora Ã© triste, vocÃª nÃ£o aguenta 10 minutos, e nÃ£o estou falando que a mÃºsica Ã© ruim, ela apenas nÃ£o combina com o clima do jogo, vocÃª ta no meio do nada lutando pra sobreviver e fica tocando uma mÃºsica relaxante de vila medieval no fundo, completamente broxante e fora de contexto. Isso sem falar a falta de feedback sonoro nas suas aÃ§Ãµes.
-As animaÃ§Ãµes sÃ£o poucas e medonhas.
----

Enfim, nÃ£o Ã© uma boa compra no momento, mas vocÃª pode tentar arriscar e investir pra apoiar o desenvolvimento do jogo. Mas como eu falei antes, os desenvolvedores parecem nÃ£o saber o que estÃ£o fazendo ou simplesmente nÃ£o tem muito conhecimento de jogos.

PS: Se vocÃª comprar pra jogar com amigos obviamente o jogo vai ficar mais divertido, porem se for jogar sozinho Ã© certo que vocÃª nÃ£o vai aguentar e vai abandonar o jogo, eu adoro jogos nesse estilo grÃ¡fico e com essa proposta de sobrevivÃªncia em terras medievais com liberdade pra ser o que vocÃª quiser, tanto que foi por isso que eu comprei no lanÃ§amento, mas mesmo assim eu nÃ£o consegui continuar jogando. Ta avisado em. =]

author: {'steamid': '76561198021619883', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 14034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6715, 'last_played': 1520840136}
review:
Its a very fun game of this type.
The negative reviews eventually steam from the fact that on this steam page it does not tell you its "IN DEVELOPMENT"

But its in develpment despite the fact they don't say that here on the steam page.
So just keep that in mind if you play it right now.

Its very fun most things are explained in the crafting window but some things they forgot to mention and you need to look it up. Like for example. Growing onions- they don't say in the crafting window that you need to  interact with them a few hours after watering them in order to get your normal large onions and that if you ignore this stage you will grow onion sets instead which are smaller. 

It wasn't hard to google it or look it in the forums on steam for the answer but there are a few things like that in the game where you might need to look it up. 
So in development is the thing to remember here even though ITS NOT MENTIONED on the steam page which is probably why it got negative reviews.

So making some metal materials you will need to learn that you may need to use forge and hammer or the bloom to make some things but sometimes they don't say  which so you just try them both.

eu estava bem animado em comprar esse jogo, fui atÃ© o centro da cidade pegar um cartÃ£o da Steam, o fiz bem empolgado, comprei o jogo e instalei....

... sabe quando o hype passa na primeira impressÃ£o e vocÃª pensa, vamos jogar um pouquinho mais e quem saber ter uma impressÃ£o diferente, ai voce comeÃ§a a ver que tem que farmar demais, Ã© daqueles jogos que vocÃª precisa ter tempo e muitos amigos, para eu construir um minimo pedacinho de muro de madeira, eu tive que desmatar meio mapa, nesse meio tempo ursos me atacaram, lobos, outros players, enfim com muito trabalho consegui o material, pouco para o tempo gasto na procura deles, ai quando voce vai construir tem um percentual de chance de dar errado e quando da errado voce perde o material que tentou usar... meu deus! eu precisava 5x a quantidade do material para 1 das vezes dar certo... bom tempo eu atÃ© teria se eu tivesse gostado do jogo, amigos tenho uma grande comunidade e muitos estÃ£o jogando esse jogo, grande maioria em tempo integral... 
o problema nÃ£o para por ai, alem de ter tempo, vocÃª precisa de algo que te atraia e isso nÃ£o aconteceu por nenhum momento que joguei, graficos feios, animaÃ§Ãµes bizarras, audio tive que tirar a musica de video game de 8 bits, atÃ© travou as vezes, tudo isso nas menos de 3 horas que joguei.
A idÃ©ia do jogo Ã© interessante, em nÃ£o ter NPC e os players que constroem tudo, mas a complexidade e o tempo que tera que dispor vai afugentar a grande maioria. Tem muitas outras opÃ§Ãµes no mercado com ideia semelhante e com muito mais atrativo.

review:
Game rhythm too procrastinate Do not believe that two people in the trailer can play a strange, how to build a town on how to build a false propaganda

Based on the following my game experience, I hope to arouse the production team's thinking, after all, the game player to play is to find happiness, not endless pain!

PVE server monster relative to the PVP server is just a few times the monster property turned several times, resulting in the monster is too strong, too perfunctory

No blood back to the props in the game, can only rely on roasted fire or wait for stamina back full, 1 point per second back to the blood speed back to the blood, killing a strange may require you to wait in place for 3-5 minutes to return full of blood

PVE server, even if it is a complete set of top equipment can not be singled out a slightly higher level of mobs, but wearing the top equipment Daguai is very deficient, because a set of top equipment materials collection and production process is very Long cut tedious!

If you want to pick up your weapon to fight, please do a 1 hour combat time, of which 30 minutes running the body on the road, 20 minutes waiting for the release of the soul, and then spend 9 minutes after resurrection, standing still waiting for full HP , Finally with only a few seconds to release skills Daguai and then lie down to wait for the release of running dead!

No Asian server is flawed, without an accelerator or VPN delay of about 100 or more, please make a greeting before the new production team prepared a million times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973598382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1515498446}
review:
The basic premise of the game is resource gathering, crafting, fighting and building, you go out into the world gathering materials and bring them back to base to make it bigger, better and prettier. If you're into PvP this is a game well suited for that.

It is a grindy game no doubt, things take time. Whilst there is a cash shop, after looking through it there wasnt anything I could see that really made me think that anything was locked behind a paywall, its mostly just better xp gains, bigger containers and some mounts and the such, all of which are not required to play.

All that being said, once you get past the first few hours and move into the mid game you quickly realise there isn't much more to it, you build a bigger base to make better tools and armour to build a bigger base to get better tools and armour and thats pretty much it, I couldn't see much beyond this, there seems to be no end game features and no real goals to achieve. For me this is where the game dropped out, stop being fun and essentially became pretty tedious and boring. Personally I wouldn't recommend this game and even though there is a slight feel of similiarity to UO, it really is a skeleton compared to the sheer scope and depth of that classic gem.

If you like crafting, progression and base building, you will likely enjoy this.
If you prefer fast action arcade games or games with depth and end goals then this probably isn't your cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982400366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11972, 'last_played': 1517815043}
review:
This is basicly mideveil farmville. Terrible game if you live in the USA....severs are so laggy it makes pvp impossible. Also the devs decided to make the us servers casual instead of hardcare like the rest of the world thanx!!! ;)

You cant go very far in this game solo either because they limited your building capabilities if you are not in a big group, thanks again for that!!!! ;)

Maps are way too small, not a lot of depth here and doesnt look like it's growing anytime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054459510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1514494828}
review:
I wouldnt mind the graphic but the overall game design is absolutly horrible, unoriginal and just a worse copy of games with similar approaches.

Why is it not possible in the 21st century for game designer to create a simple and easy to learn but hard to master, complex crafting and building game, which also has a working economy and meaningful PVP?

I am really looking forward to interesting MMOs but currently it seems there are only these 2 types of games:

1, standard 3D MMO, which are often walking simulators, shitty ingame economies and are boring as hell

2, shitty browser games which are cash grabs and heavily rely on offline progression and P2W


There really isnt much beyond these 2 types currently in 2017. I dont understand it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963119802', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 4802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4802, 'last_played': 1515142829}
review:
IMPORTANT UPDATE JANUARY 3RD

Dev said this to me instead of helping - 
- https://imgur.com/qyVyI2d
- https://imgur.com/PVM5QqF

Pretty classy for a Dev to be saying things like that and offering zero help, when I have already shown him all the evidence and the screenshot, he cares nothing for the real exploit and issue at hand, he just wanted a forum fight for some reason. Now he just cost them money and players.

We found a player exploiting their ingame system by building on peoples bases, that are already fully built, for example he would build walls inside your gate, even while its closed, right on top of it, yet this isnt even possible for you to double up and build.

I reported this, and screenshoted everything posted it, and the Dev told me because I posted it on their official Steam forums, it wont be seen and no one will care, specially not him.

Now I reported this very kindly with full details entrailing everything, he responded instantly by telling me the Steam forums arent the place for help... I responded I have played many steam games, this is where the help and support comes from. 

He then responded again that they dont care about the Steam forums, and only care about Discord and other players views.. 

Well buddy, I was one of your players, giving you insight on your games exploiters, you didnt care, you told me off and now I write a fancy negative review instead of a positive due to the fact you told me off while I was trying to give you support, you read obviously NOTHING about the exploiter and instead made me out to be the bad guy for using your Steam forums for support and posting pictures.

Goodluck with this game, now when people message me about Wild Terra Online, I know exactly what to show them.

Thanks!

Bug/Exploit was CONFIRMED - yet people still troll and flame, oh and it wasn't by him, another player whom also is on that thread, took his time to report it and get it confirmed.

review:
El juego estÃ¡ muy bien, pero tienen que cambiar muchas cosas, para tener algo decente debes meterle minimo 100h
la curva de aprendizaje es excesivamente dificultosa y leeeenta.
en el foro oficial cuando los usuarios realizan criticas constructivas,los dev responden ofensivamente (algo no muy normal)

de momento no lo recomiendo,una vez salga de EA y si hacen los cambios "lÃ³gicos" que la gente les pide, es posible que cambie mi voto,pero de momento esto es lo que debo de poner para informar a las personas.

AÃ‘ADO: mucho no va a cambiar el juego por lo visto, los devs hasta regalan keys del juego, lo que les interesa es que la gente pague por las cajas dentro del juego P2W, ya que hay alguna habilidad que llegado un momento tiene un tope y no puedes superarlo si no pagas por una caja donde tienes ese plus de exp para seguir subiendo la habilidad.

asi que creo que el negativo se va a quedar asi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144964616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1215, 'last_played': 1511702096}
review:
Auque el juego este en una fase temprana, nos presenta una idea buena.
Orientado a una era medieval, donde recolectar cada recurso para lograr fundar un castillo con tu propo esfuerzo  y dedicacion o jugar con otros jugadores que podran ser tus mejores aliado o combatir y ganar territorio

espero que el juego cresca como Dios manda y nos de horas y horas de distraccion y entrenimiento

author: {'steamid': '76561198114887124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1554417955}
review: The game is in Early Access yet (Alpha) but I see a lot of possibilities in the game. You can lose your stuffs if you die, but you can go back for your body if you've died in a peaceful place, you'll be able to get back your loot only, but if you've died in a "PvP" area, anyone can loot you. The map is missing in the game, but you can see where you can find your home or your body if you wanna get back your stuffs because of death. I can recommend the game to anyone, who likes to level abilities like mining, and wanna see the progress of the game from the beginnings. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197986721372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1511541562}
review:
Just bumping a old review to try and sway a few people from being scammed into getting into this game.


Features that were once part of the paid game are now locked behind a monthly pay wall. to play single player or have a private server, now you need a $15 a month subscription. too bad I cant refund this ptw cash grab. Stay away from this game and these greedy devs.

edit: 12/23/2017

the developer is now going to review threads and lying about what they originaly advertised last year.

the developers keep doing a bait and switch. when i bought the game you got a free private server just for buying the game. somewhere along the line they got greedy and decided if you want a private server you have to pay a monthy subscription for it. now i believe they are removing private servers all together so more people play on official servers.

if i buy a game when its advertised that when you buy the game you get a FREE private server i expect it to remain FREE. not wait a few months then decide that if you want to keep your server you have to start paying for it.

Again stay away from this game, do not give these people your hard earned money.
developer_response: This information is not true. Game has no paid subscription. Private servers were the part of Alpha tests. They were removed due to no interest from player's majority.

review:
Wild Terra es un simulador de supervivencia medieval online multijugador masivo con un mundo abierto conducido por los jugadores. Todo el mundo podrÃ¡ encontrar una actividad que le guste: construcciÃ³n, fabricaciÃ³n, recolecciÃ³n y eventos de reclamaciÃ³n de terrenos. No hay NPCs en el juego, asÃ­ que la Ãºnica forma de conseguir algo es crearlo tÃº mismo o comprarlo a otros jugadores... o tomarlo por la fuerza. Todos los procesos del juego estÃ¡n creados para hacer el juego un poco mÃ¡s sencillo.

Lo mismo podemos decir del progreso de los personajes. Es muy aburrido tener que subir el nivel de tu personaje para poder equipar una espada y poder luchar. HabrÃ¡ niveles, pero sÃ³lo te proporcionarÃ¡n una pequeÃ±a ventaja en el combate, no una dominaciÃ³n total.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111350656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1512394230}
review:
OK here is the straight info on this game.  Update was banned from community

1 Its dead as player pops go.
2 Its a cash grab point blank. Pay for the rite to play on a server then pay to win with the cash shop. Buy chests so you get a head start on recipes or buy scrolls to upgrade items. All the cash shop themes found in all PtWs.
3 Its a russian dev using a old isometric game engine and feel the sprites are from a asset pack. And got a virus warning when installing it since it uses old code that needs to be patched.
4 The wiki is a joke. Basic stuff is not documented and forums you get please ref to wiki. So get to were you blindly hunt for next step when crafting.

So over all this game is a waist of time if you like building games like Wurm online. Its got same issues that mine craft had with greifers. And think this will be dead when it is released because most will leave after the first hour and request a refund. Like grand pappy said "run and don't look back because it will only harm you body spirit and soul."

Edit 11/24/17

WARNING WARNING WARNING
 The devs of this game is taking money from cash shops on private servers knowing full well they are closing them in a few days. Don't support scum moves like this. They are doing a cash grab and we as players are losing out. So if you are buying this on black friday bewarned they stated they are closing private servers in their discord channel. But still taking money in the cash shop. I just lost 20$ in stuff I bought there. Paid 3 months for the private server got 2 weeks to play it.
developer_response:
He actually lost nothing and got all his money back and his private server is also working. And he is able to prolong it for free for another 3 months, because we returned all money that people invested in our game as soon as we released the game.
I just want to clarify that this warning is a lie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081175064', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1539915355}
review: One of the greatest mmos I've ever played! Brings me back to UO. I'm not super far yet and have no clue how to use the simple house design (if someone could help that'd be great) but I really love it. 9/10 need different races and more players (not up to devs how big population is.) also character creation (they said they'll be adding!) and a taming tutorial!

author: {'steamid': '76561198125760789', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 6346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6221, 'last_played': 1549231345}
review:
After 100 hours of playing this game I can tell you that it  BORNING  and GRINDING. 

Don't believe me? look at this [url=https://wildterra.gamepedia.com/Skills] Wild terra wiki	[/url]

Each of those skill are boring to grind as hell.

I play World of tank, and that game is grinding and it fun, but this game it just make you work with little reward.

Oh and it have some pain in the ass bugs for example the game freezing, keep disconnect you, and many more.

Last thing. If you want a grinding, fun, and chill game then try Stardew Valley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003818180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1599, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1513994136}
review:
Cualquier persona que quiera ver este juego terminado, o un clon de uno de sus juegos favoritos, que estÃ© acostumbrado a conseguir todo de forma rÃ¡pida y sin esfuerzo, vaya pasando de largo. AquÃ­, los jugadores participan directamente en el desarrollo del juego (la gran mayorÃ­a de las innovaciones son discutidas por los desarrolladores con todos los jugadores). Entiendo perfectamente que el juego cambiarÃ¡ para mejor..

Como en la vida real, para convertirte en un profesional, necesitas gastar tiempo y recursos. Para llevar a cabo una operaciÃ³n exitosa (robo, mina en Tierra Maldita, la bÃºsqueda del tesoro), es necesario prepararse para ella y considerar cuidadosamente las acciones de cada equipo.

El mundo de WT es diverso y eres libre de elegir cualquier estilo de vida en el juego. Puedes dedicarle mucho tiempo, o  jugar durante una hora todos los dÃ­as. Puede volverse peligroso y odioso para todo guerrero o maestro..
Es un juego bastante hardcore no apto para gente con poca paciencia o que busque que se lo regalen todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040572981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1509541150}
review:
It's a terrible game that allows griefers to steal your sh!t and destroy your base, even on the "peaceful"/pve server.

To perpetuate the theme, I chopped down 300 apple trees someone planted.

You can't even move an item from one inventory slot to another if the inventory is full because this game is so badly designed and programmed.

And let's not get into how there are "Level 57" zombie(?) wolves and bears that aggro and one-shot you while you're out trying to get resources to build the base someone else is just going to ruin as soon as you're offline.

Hell, this game can't even get the color of water correct.  (Water is not the color of lava, and lava doesn't freeze in the winter, so the Devs f*cked up big-time on this idea.)

F*ck this game.  It's not even worth $6.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133606728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1625775905}
review:
Un juego que se necesita mucha paciencia, si eres de los que quiere conseguir las cosas rapido y estar en accion a cada rato no es lo tuyo.

Wild Terra es un juego muy bueno y que contiene diversos items y estructuras, donde puedes hacer un refugio a una ciudad completa.

Lo jugue por una invitacion de Wild Terra Online Las, las primeras impresiones fue el lagg, no me va a mas de 30 fps, pero es obvio ya que esta en desarrollo.

Que me motiva? es la gran variedad, aventura y ganas de seguir siendo el mejor del mapa, es verdad que no hay muchos players, pero esos los que estamos le damos vida a esto para que mas gente llegue, asi que comprenlo, jueguenlo y recomiendenlo y ya veran que sera un juego top de top cuando salga esa actualizacion que tanto esperamos, LA FINAL.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992634453', 'num_games_owned': 1316, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1619641127}
review:
This is a game that you have to be willing to research and learn from scratch. This is also a game that you have to be willing to lose a lot in. There are still some bugs and minor issues.

With those things being said, it is magnificient. This game gives you the ability to build your own little area and advance at the pace that you can/want to. It is a little bit of a grind fest, I'll admit that, but that is part of the awesomeness of it! 

There aren't a whole lot of people that play, but I've noticed a LOT of activity on the PvE server lately.

This is definitely worth a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972871476', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1520301549}
review:
EDIT 5/8/2018: game is dead completely if you are english speaking, i wouldn't even take a free key at this point, on top of that they are now using fake accounts to review their game positively. 
EDIT: as of 3/13/18 there is no way i can recomend this game. the original review is at the bottom of this.
it's a decent game, but the population will not grow above what it is infact it may have dropped since my original review but i can't confirm that. ontop of this, if you speak english, you're fucked. the devs are all english as a second language, and they really are not focused on english speaking customers at all, which i suppose isn't that big a deal since the english servers are EMPTY.

also, it's been made a public announcment that the admins WILL help people bypass your walls if those people can prove there is something of worth (such as a godsend) that your walls are keeping them from getting.

if you can ignore the fact that admins will help players bypass their own game systems because they are flawed, and that they barely speak english.. well then by all means, check the comments section to read my original review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011394911', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1557749042}
review:
I have been looking at this game for quite some time and decided to take the plunge this week. 
All in all, I say it is ok. I dont mind the graphics at all, a lot like an ancient Project Zomboid. I do mind that the game is pretty much devoid of anything fun to do. I thought the treasure hunt would add an aspect of fun. But once i got to my first one, I found that it is way too difficult to deal with at early levels. Pretty much instant death. 
I imagine that if your a hard core PVP person, and if there are enough players, that could add some fun to the game. 
I know it is early access, and I actually like the play style and basis of the game. I just hope that they can get some content built in to make it fun. Just buiding a castle and farm doesnt do it for me. If it is your thing, go for it. I would say 6 out of 10 right now. 

I will definitly check in again with other updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054333256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1613920874}
review:
This game has a lot of potential, still i CANNOT recommend at the state it is right now and asked for a refund. 

First.. Well, nobody in asia servers. I played for 2 hours and didn't find a single soul. Better make it single player with a story.
Second.. Tutorial isn't clear on HOW to make use of it's options, it just throws an image at you.
Third.. I could only find 2-3 types of animals (hare, small birds and maybe some foxes) that i can actually try to kill in 2 hours of gameplay. This makes it very stale at some point and voided of action.

I believe though, that this game can improve a lot, and i certainly like this kind of game. I just think it's not even ready for early access..

author: {'steamid': '76561198040979867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1851, 'last_played': 1573409032}
review:
Not a ton of time in the game but enough that I recommend it during this alpha stage. I'm a fan of PZ and LIF. Not as grindy as LIF but still decent, which for me, makes it fun and worth the play. It is very detailed like PZ which I love. Seems some haters, who no longer play, are spamming the forums which initially made me second guess the purchase. I did it anyways and think it's great. Read all reviews for sure!

The graphics have opportunity to be more crisp but not a show stopper. I hope the water/weather  graphics are worked on next big update since that is very bland. 

Combat is still being evaluated since I do PVE mostly I only fight animals. 

Crafting is very in-dept, and I believe the higher your stats and skill set are the more you can obtain when gathering resources as well as increase the quality/quantity. 

Only con so far is the lack of players online whether it is PVE or PVP. It isn't a deal breaker but would be nice to see more people. 

The PVE servers have a decay timer (about a week IRL). Zero server wipe system that I have seen as the decay helps with that. Overall, worth the price at $19.99 and the developers are still very involved from what I can tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113981372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2478, 'last_played': 1612313002}
review:
I want to send this review for any buyer who wants to play a survival based game.  As much I want to say that this is 100% great there are some flaws. I researched for about 10 mins when I bought it and while playing it there is very little info about the game. Most of the forums barely say anything and most of the wiki is brand spanking new. This is hardcore at best. Think of Force of Nature mixed with Rust.  Ive played this since saturday evening, changed servers twice. The first 3 hours I was aimlessly trying to gather stuff. I stared to build the first tier structures to enclose my base. Not knowing that I had to do the second tier because the first tier other players can easly get your gear. Think of thatch foundations for Ark. I notice that the spawn rates are very scarce. I had to look for coal, trees, and clay when I need to look for them and little to find but when i didnt i could find them everywhere. 

Early Access 9/27/17 Flaws - May change 
1. Browser based game. (I dont hate browser based games but when I have played this for at least three minutes the borders of the game would flicker and cover the moniter. OCD makes me twitch a little. If I catch up to the black parts the game seems to lag and force me to stop.  

2. Spawn Rates to need to be increase. Not saying from 1.0 to 5.0% just add a comfortable amount. Not sure the issue of whether the game is about player economy where you have to plant trees. If thats true, make saplings more accessible. 

3. Players in Survival Games - Only games I have ever had issues with people being rude and not friendly were Rust, and Reign of Kings. This game "WTO" noone talks and they wait for you to log off for the night or work the next day and they raid your base. Literally, inches away from other nodes to gather, they rather steal from you. Im really not sure about this game and the toxicity of the player base. This even happened on a pve server in the safer zones. To gain more playerbase make offline raiding harder like adding turrets or let your mounts be about to attack players. I could make more design for this if needed. (Email me Devs)

4. Combat - Very little - For the week I have played, I had full bronze gear and have died to everything from a young fox to Big Bear. I understand this game is based on "skill" leveling and not more of a "stat" leveling like Diablo. You can have 1 mil strength and not be any stronger from the beginning. Ive checked all the updates from the devs and nothing about this system give any clarity. 

5. (a) GodSend / (b) Fragments/ (c) Items from the Cashshops - This game is not pay to win - now the game is still being developed and has a year or two of implementing new concepts and twinking to making the game more polish, not sure how big the dev team is but need to make your road map more clear. We the players need more incentive to play the game not saying to give us things but allow us to know what you are working on. You dont have to have big milestones but let us know whats coming to game and what bugs you guys need us to report. 

(a). GodSend's (c) CashShop - This feature has saved me from death and helped me gear my character. The game doesnt really give much description on what workstation does. Ive spent alot of time trying to learn how to make an effective bronze ingot. This should be easy to learn. I understand you guys are making dungeons and caves in the near futures so I cant complain much about the loot system.  I love it. Keep making more items to do this. This also allows players to gain items from the cash shop without paying. Ive gotten Premiums twice, and got 1 bronze key with two Bronze chests and Iron chest. Its accessible. This should be mention in any debate that the cash shop is pay 2 conveince. You can pay to get something now and not have to play the game or play and not pay and learn to get those items for free from money but pay in time. 

(b) Fragments - This is cool system, but where does it tell you how many you collect makes it to become a reciepe nothing online tells me that theres a hotkey to find the list of fragments youve encounter and click on the reciepe to learn known receipe. Or does it automatically implement in the crafting/building skill. 

Okay guys this is the flaws I love to hate. Please read to the end to get my final opinon of the game. With all these flaws the game seems pretty complete. It really just needs the player population to increase and polish, polish, polish. I rather play it through unity or udk, but from my experiences of making games myself you build your game on what you can do. Keep up the good work Devs and Ill be patient to see whats to come. The game is more about hardcore patience. Thank you.

review:
(English version in the end, not literal translation.)

-------------------VersÃ£o em PortuguÃªs-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Adorei o jogo! Ã‰ meu estilo favorito, no entanto nÃ£o Ã© divertido para todo mundo, como Ã© possivel entender pelos outros reviews, mas quero resaltar alguns pontos prÃ³s e contras na minha visÃ£o.

PrÃ³s:
- O grinding, com certeza, Ã© eterno. Tudo vocÃª precisa coletar um numero imenso de itens para poder fazer um item, que vai virar um outro item, pra virar outro item...e finalmente chegar no item que vocÃª queria. Mas o que Ã© problema para alguns, isso me diverte e torna as coisas interessantes. Esse Ã© o ponto principal pra eu gostar do jogo.
- Muita opÃ§Ã£o de construÃ§Ã£o. Tem uma variedade de itens pra fazer, nÃ£o chega a ter uma dificuldade de criaÃ§Ã£o como outros jogos do genero, que para criar uma parede vocÃª precisa pegar o numero exato de madeiras que vÃ£o naquela parede e o numero de pregos exatos que vocÃª vai usar, MAS vocÃª vai precisar pegar madeiras e forjar pregos, sÃ³ Ã© um pouco menos "real" ou "demorado". Isso Ã© um ponto muito bom, na minha visÃ£o, torna um pouco mais facil de realizar as construÃ§Ãµes e criar seu reino dos sonhos mas sem tirar a dificuldade e realidade de ter que fazer pregos e juntar madeiras pras coisas que necessitam disso.  (A madeira e o prego foi sÃ³ um exemplo, tem outros itens que usam ooutras coisas tambÃ©m.)
- Liberdade, mapa gigante, muita coisa pra explorar (apesar de nÃ£o ter cavernas ainda, atÃ© o momento que escrevi esse review), muita coisa pra fazer. Se tiver amigos que gostam do estilo, chame-os. Se nÃ£o tiver, Ã© sÃ³ procurar por grupos e fazer novas amizades, Ã© divertido de jogar sozinho, mas com um lugar tÃ£o grande e cheio de coisas, umas mÃ£os a mais para construir seu reino serÃ£o sempre bem vindas. 

Contras:
- O jogo rodou um pouco lagado quando a camera estÃ¡ distante, diminuindo conforme eu deixo mais proximo, apesar de nÃ£o ter graficos tÃ£o exigentes assim (NÃ£o testei todas as possibilidades pra tentar descobrir o que Ã©, mas irei). Mas isso nÃ£o diminui a diversÃ£o que o jogo proporciona (Talvez para o pvp seja uma desvantagem.)
- Loja in-game. NÃ£o sei bem o que hÃ¡ dentro dos baÃºs pra vender, mas acredito que sejam itens provenientes de crafting ou blueprints, Ã© uma desvantagem pra quem busca se divertir se esforÃ§ando, mas a longo prazo e no PvE, Ã© algo que nÃ£o faz tanta diferenÃ§a a ponto de estragar o gameplay.  JÃ¡ no pvp isso faz uma grande diferenÃ§a e acaba sendo atÃ© um pouco chato.
-Early Access. Ã‰ claro, tem tudo pra ser um jogasso, tem potencial pra encantar muita gente com uma proposta jÃ¡ conhecida pelo publico gamer, mas da sua forma. SÃ³ que early access Ã© por um motivo, o jogo nÃ£o estÃ¡ completo, ainda faltam coisas e erros acontecem. Se vocÃª nÃ£o tem paciÃªncia pra isso, melhor esperar o jogo ser completado antes de comprar, ou a decepÃ§Ã£o vai acabar sendo maior.

Bom, pra concluir, os pontos negativos nÃ£o foram algo tÃ£o forte pra me fazer desistir do jogo ou de deixar de indica-lo a outras pessoas. Ã‰ incrivelmente divertido para mim tudo que Ã© proposto. Mesmo que o jogo seja sempre uma planice e nunca tenhamos montanhas, ainda vou gostar. Mas se montanhas surgirem, possibilidades de construir sua cidadela ao pÃ© ou no alto de uma e de explorar suas cavernas seriam coisas que trariam ainda mais brilho para esse jogo.


--------------------------English version-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I loved the game! It's my favorite style, however it's not funny for everyone, as we can see in others' reviews, but I would like to show my opinion.

Pros:
- Grinding. Forever. You need a lot of resources of all kind, to build an item, that is needed to build another item, and another, and another... and finally build the one you wanted from the begining. It's a problem for some, but not for me, it's fun and interesting. That's why I love the game that much.
- There is a lot of construction options. Many itens to build that is not so hard to build as in other survival games. Like building a wall would cost the exactly number of wood and nails, although in this game we only use a few. It's easier to build, but still "real" and a little difficult.
- Freedom, huge map, lot to explore (even knowing that there is no dungeons yet.) Lot of things to do. If you have friends to play with you, call them. If not, search for groups and make some new, it's fun to play alone, but it's better playing with friends to build a really huge realm.

Cons:
- The game was a little laggy while the camera was far, better performance as I zoom in. (Didn't checked all options yet to see what could it be.) It's nothing while playing PvE, but for PvP would be bad.
- In-game purchase. I don't see a problem for PvE, it's like you started today and the other person started some months ago. Not much to worry. But for PvP it means advantage against all non-paying players.
- Early Access. If you not into helping, WAIT. I don't see many bugs, but it could happen, so better wait if you don't like to test.

Bom, pra concluir, os pontos negativos nÃ£o foram algo tÃ£o forte pra me fazer desistir do jogo ou de deixar de indica-lo a outras pessoas. Ã‰ incrivelmente divertido para mim tudo que Ã© proposto. Mesmo que o jogo seja sempre uma planice e nunca tenhamos montanhas, ainda vou gostar. Mas se montanhas surgirem, possibilidades de construir sua cidadela ao pÃ© ou no alto de uma e de explorar suas cavernas seriam coisas que trariam ainda mais brilho para esse jogo.
Conclusion : Though there are some negatives points, it's not enough to make me given up. It's fun for me, even if it would stay a plain world I would still play. But if some mountains appears, with possibility to build around it, or on it and eplore its dungeon, it will be even better and funny!!

review: Recomiendo el juego, tiene muchas cosas positivas como negativas, darÃ© mi opinion desde un server PVP que es donde iniciÃ©, es verdad que tiene bastante contenido, pero, carece de acciÃ³n, estoy con una guild en el server latinoamericano, al principio era entretenido porque tenÃ­amos otra guild con quien estabamos en guerra pero de la nada se fueron todos, la falta de jugadores lo estÃ¡ haciendo muy aburrido, solo entramos a recolectar recursos, subir skills y era... tiene un sistema de crafteo bastante interesante pero a la vez con algunas cosas es muy tedioso, en lo personal le he dedicado mucho tiempo en tan pocos dÃ­as (3 semanas mÃ¡s menos) lo cual no lo hace menos pero, la falta de gente, de contenido mÃ¡s variado como enemigos, biomas y/o mÃ¡s jefes, lo estÃ¡ matando de a poco, pero le tengo fe que a la fecha de lanzamiento pongas mÃ¡s cosas, pero lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996984386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1516456966}
review:
This game has a lot of potential. But its also playable as it is now. Yes, the graphic might be a bit rough around the edges, but the gameplay is very promising.

I like that you can build your own castle (Eventually), and that its not just something you do in a day. You can do it on your own, but i guess it will help to have friends on the server. 

There is no in-game map, but you will eventually now your way around, even though the map is huge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995201947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 35096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1519580694}
review:
I was very lucky to win this game on the PCGames website.

This game is still on Alpha, so things will move on. There really is plenty of game time here. 13.6 hours in, and I've only fashioned one item of clothes and no covered shelter so far. I will need more of the relevant experience for a complete basic small animal skin set of clothes.  I have however progessed in many other areas, that seemed more important. Set up camp, finding enough food to stay alive and adding a fence to keep killer animals out. I've fashioned ovens for food, metal smelting and pottery. Also built a well and raised a first crop. Each task requiring multiple abilities to complete. 

I had a good start with the Early Access armoured boar mount, which frightens off the majority of animals, but still easy to be killed and respawn back at base.

I'm very much a PVE player and one just selects ones server for that.  Co-operative ventures seem well provided for, but I've played solo so far.

I see myself staying addicted to this game for a while :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007224689', 'num_games_owned': 2510, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1521443682}
review:
Edit: After a long time i have decided to switch my review from positive to negative, the reason i put a positive review was because i saw in this game what could be a lot of good potential, if done right.

But now after a long time, not a lot has happend in the terms of patches and the developers started creating a new early access game which is basically a spin off of this game and even uses the same assets.

Its all starting to smell cash grab to me, luckily i got my copy for free like so many others, probably an attempt to lure people to use their in-game cash store which is pretty extensive for such a small unfinished game.
