author: {'steamid': '76561198040656360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 46569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6537, 'last_played': 1611197677}
review:
First off I would just like to say that I LOVE THIS GAME!!! Sure its a bit rough around the edges right now, but the possibilities are endless! This is not a game for everyone, and I will warn you that if you are not into survival games, REALISM, etc., then you need to keep walking right on by. This is not a game for those seeking an easy way to "Master" a game, quick payoffs or pay to win, but rather for those that like to work hard and feel a real sense of accomplishment when all the hard work pays off. 

Just like in the real world, there are things we all need to not only survive, but to prosper. We need shelter, a bed, food/water, clothing, heat and cooking, weapons for hunting and defense, a place to put our things so that they are not stolen(storage), transportation, etc., etc. This game handles that splendidly with ultra realism! Everything that you have, you must earn through hard work, creativity, and experience. There is no "Just go to the store and buy it". For example, if you need a shirt, you have to "learn" how to make it...you have to gather the supplies, build the tools, keep it clean and maintained, etc. If you want to keep the rain off your head you have to learn how to build a shelter and gather what is needed. Think the hard part is over? Getting what you need is just the beginning! Now comes the trial and error of trying to make that shirt or the shelter! Tools can be broken, materials can be wasted/destroyed, etc. JUST LIKE IN REAL LIFE! Through it all, your avatar will learn and grow, and eventually things will be mastered and easier to construct. Just like riding a bike in real life, you may have fallen off, been injured, broke your bike, etc., but through trial and eror, you eventually learned how to do it and to perfection! And do you remember how gratifying it was once you had learned how to do it? 

As with building, there is also a learning curve for your character and you when it comes to hunting, resource gathering, protecting yourself, etc. The more you do things, the better you get at them. Creatures in this game are no slouch either just as they are not in real life. You will not go toe to toe with a bear. You will not outrun a wolf. If you have to fight, well good luck!

Lastly, there are natural things you will have to contend with. Birds eating your seeds, weather killing your crops, starvation, etc.


So with all that said to give you an idea what you will be up against, there are a few other things that may turn you off or that do need some polish. I am sure many of these are in the works!

1- No map. Sure if I were stranded out in the wild in real life, I wouldnt have a map. But I would remember my surroundings, and eventually know where everything was based off landmarks...and it really wouldnt be hard to draw my own map. There would still be the issue of never knowing what was around every corner and what was waiting to kill me, but at least I would have some direction. The game has indicators that tell you the direction of home and your corpse, but that is it. Maybe in the future the devs will impliment a map making skill and map of some sort, or like in older games, have a mini map which is revealed more and more as the player explores. I personally do not mind not having one as it adds to the anxiety and stress level of the game.

2- Lag. This game needs optimization and some server work something fierce. The longer your play session the worse it gets. I find that I am reloading after every couple of hours which fixes the issue temporarily. 

3- Mount AI. There is none. You can mount and ride and unmount....and if you choose, kill and loot resources. They do not follow you, protect you (those that should be able to such as wolves and bears), and there is no way to call them to your location after dismounting to do whatever it is you need to do (whistling for your horse, etc.) There are a RARE FEW that have an inventory icon that you can use to "summon" them to your location, but that is it. Walk to far and forget where you left your mount and well, your out of luck and have to find, catch, and tame another one. It is possible to find them again down the road as they will never move from where you left them. They do not eat, and there is no upkeep, but they do die if attacked.

4-Limited creature types, ore/gem types, and activities. I have logged a ton of hours and so far I have only seen 10 different types of creatures, all can be hunted and similiar resources gathered. This is all fine and dandy, just gets a bit stale after a while. Considering the setting is wilderness, I would like to see some creatures like mountain lions/cougars,  large birds like eagles and hawks/falcons, snakes and reptiles, and a fishing system with various types of fresh water and salt water species. The ore system now is sufficient dont get me wrong, but would be nice to see some rare precious/semi-precious stones and ores for a bit of flavor. 

5- No age system, mating/children, hardcore mode. I know I know, all of you just went rated XXX on me. What I mean by this, and just to add to the realism, is to add an aging system so that there is a time sensative aspect to the game, and decisions made are even more critical. It would also open up other systems that could be implimented such as assigning chores to the kids, teaching them to hunt/fish, build, a trait system, etc. The possibilites are quite astonishing here! 

6- Lack of players!!!! Its pretty lonely in the game right now, and only we the players can fix that. I have to admit though, that when I do see someone, my anxiety level and stress levels go through the roof! I play on the PvP servers and you just never know when someone is going to try and take you down!

In the end, the game mechanics and the systems used are as realistic as it gets. The game, just like real life, keeps the proverbial "carrot" dangling in front of you, keeping you going and going and going! As of now, the world is a bit sparse of players and interaction, but I hope that changes soon!

I highly recommmend this game, and I hope the Devs keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049499246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 23760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14788, 'last_played': 1527416429}
review:
Bueno, creo que ya tengo las suficientes horas como para opinar (casi 400 cuando escribo esto). Recalco que mi experiencia es Ãºnica y exclusiva en el servidor PVE, donde el PVP estÃ¡ limitado a zonas muy concretas y tus construcciones jamÃ¡s son arrasadas por un grupo de eslavos a las cinco de la madrugada mientras tÃº duermes indefenso.

El juego tiene cosas positivas  y negativas, como todos. TratarÃ© de plasmarlas aquÃ­ y que cada uno las sopese para ver quÃ© decisiÃ³n toma, si acercarse a conocerlo u obviarlo.

a) A favor

1.- GrÃ¡ficos estilo UO mejorados, los nostÃ¡lgicos dejarÃ¡n caer una lÃ¡grima.
2.- Precio contenido y asequible. Obvia y evidentemente estoy hablando de comprarlo en oferta, nadie en su sano juicio deberÃ­a pagar mÃ¡s de diez euros por un early acces. Y no olvidemos que esto es una alpha.
3.- EstÃ¡ en castellano
4.- Consume muy pocos recursos.
5.- No hay lÃ­mite de aprendizaje, por lo que puedes segÃºn te den las ganas por dedicarte a la carpinterÃ­a o a la construcciÃ³n o a la caza o a la sastrerÃ­a...

b) En contra

1.- Total desconexiÃ³n con el mundo y su historia, que es inexistente. EstÃ¡s en medio de la nada nadie sabe por quÃ© ni para quÃ©. No hay una ciudad central en la que poder encontrar a otros jugadores, lo que hace que mucha gente abandone el juego totalmente desalentado. Inexistencia absoluta de un reino, un mundo, una trama, algo, lo que sea.
2.- Micropagos en la alpha. SÃ­, por alucinante que parezca venden ( y la gente compra) monturas especiales por 64 â‚¬, lo que acaba conduciendo al juego inevitablemente a un pay to win, pero matizado, no serÃ¡ fÃ¡cil matar a nadie, aunque lo que a ti te lleva horas y horas de juego otros lo consiguen pagando. Repito, es una alpha.
3.- Las mejoras se introducen muy muy muy despacio, lo que desanima bastante. AquÃ­ introduzco un temor: que los desarrolladores vayan por el dinero fÃ¡cil de los micropagos y el juego muera en su alpha.
4.- Hay una clara curva de desarrollo que se frena con un muro al llegar a trabajar con material de hierro... que se puede soslayar, claro estÃ¡, pagando.
5.- Falta total de npcs y monstruos con los que interactuar, bien sea negociando, bien sea combatiendo. Tienes como animales no hostiles castores liebres pÃ¡jaros zorros y venados ( y caballos), y como hostiles osos y lobos. Y ya estÃ¡. Como mucho en algÃºn lugar perdido algÃºn monstruo... que nada aporta.
6.- No hay dungeons, minas, templos, campamentos de enemigos, puertos... nada de nada.

En resumen... juego entretenido, al que echarle horas sin aburrirte. Atrae mÃ¡s por lo que puede ser que por lo que es ahora. Si el staff entra a fondo y apuntala el mundo dÃ¡ndole un entorno consistente (ciudades, reinos, historia...) este juego puede romper en algo grandioso. Si el staff se deja llevar por el dinero fÃ¡cil cerrarÃ¡n cuando hayan exprimido la vaca de los jugadores y jamÃ¡s pasarÃ¡ de la alpha o la beta.

A pesar de todos los pesares, os animo a que le deis una oportunidad y como mÃ­nimo lo pongais en la lista de seguidos, si hacen bien las cosas esto puede ser algo grande.

i wish i haven't won this so i wont have to write this and warn everyone spending 15â‚¬ on this...."thing"

go play haven and hearth or salem instead this

author: {'steamid': '76561198236853908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1504990673}
review: La verdad es un juego con mucho contenido para hecharte literalmente una vida jugando, pero su mapa es totalmente desmotivador y plano, puedes caminar 1 hr y no ver nada interesante, no estaria mal una cascada, montaÃ±a o biomas planos, pero es todo igual. El progrso del juego es lentisimo, no me molesta que en un juego sea difcil progresar, pero en WT en eterno y monotono debido al mapa. Un juego con mucho potencial pasare a jugar en unos 6 meses mas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385673931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 160856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11430, 'last_played': 1600436771}
review:
Best game ever.  I love that its not first person view.  I like seeing the player i am guilding.  Most online games are not like this.  I also love the PVE version.  Again many games do not have this and I dont like to fight.  It was tough at first to get the hang of avoiding predators but after a while you get the hang of that too.  I am a 76 yr old great-grandmother and love that the game keeps my mind active.  Improves my coordination and amazing how my side vision has improved watching for godsends and predators.  If every  'old' person played this game it would surely help their state of mind.  The body might decline but game keeps mind from declining.  
Great job guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057734650', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7171, 'last_played': 1580366961}
review: Wild Terra Online is a rather interesting game. I found and still find it to enjoyable from time to time however due to the current way the game functions I have begun playing it less and less as the game feels like it wants to trap players. The game is not very popular in the United States so most of the US Servers, whether they be PVE or PVP are often completely empty of players or at the very least the number of players ranges fewer than 10 per server. The game features a skill tree that is arguably a cornerstone of gameplay. Various resources can be found across servers however unless you max out all of your skills (which can take a great deal of time) you won't really have access to all of the resources. It should also be said that even if you max out all of your skills you will still be limited in what you can do as certain items require you to learn recipes to craft them. These new recipes are found in "Godsends" that randomly generate around the map and at times can be rather difficult to find. Furthermore even if you find a Godsend there is a good chance that the recipe fragments you get may be fragments to a recipe you already know. This is used for a "Golden Plan" which lets you craft certain items on all of their servers. So once you've maxed out your skills and learned all recipes, perhaps even all golden plans in order to keep your fortune it is very likely you will need to play this game routinely or your loot will be taken away. The game lets players claim land with dominiums however once you leave the game your dominium can keep your claim for only a set period of time until it breaks and then your base can be easily sacked. If you play on PVP servers you not only have to worry about your Dominium HP but your server's seige time as well. During seige time players can build siege engines and tear down walls then dominiums allowing your base to be sacked if you don't have good enough gear/skills or if you're just alone or offline. Every part of the way the game is centered around spending time playing the game. This would be fine if the game didn't punish players so severely for the time they're not playing. The one last thing that should be considered is that the game is still in early access. Perhaps the developers will fix or change things and I might return to Wild Terra someday. However that looks to be unlikely especially with their time consuming game having an ingame store that allows you to buy certain items and privledges that place wealthier players above others. Overall I would not recommend this game. In the short-term you might have fun, in the long-term you'll have wasted your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971407446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1577305021}
review:
I have played a ton of MMOâ€™s in my life and this one is no exception to the rule. 
Time will fly past in RL as you begin to build your own little kingdom!

It has a range of combat styles and a crafting system that will have you grinding on different minerals for a few minutes / hours at a time.  Like any survival game you start with nothing but you can get your own safe area going fairly quickly where you can store your harvest runs.

The crafting system is deep enough to keep you interested although waiting for God Sends (treasures) to give you all the right stuff you need will take you probably more time than you are prepared to put in, unless you are really into the game.
You can cheat it at the store and use RL cash but alas this is not my style.

Game Play 7/10 â€“ I think it takes too long to kill deer!
Crafting 8/10 - Grind it out you pussy!

Overall 7.5 Still in early release itâ€™s not a bad game.

Enjoy

author: {'steamid': '76561198120154364', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 31038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29103, 'last_played': 1549971589}
review:
Good skill-based mmo with lots of crafting and housing.
God, if I've read the comments then probably I've missed this game.

People complain a lot about 1) community and 2) donation in p2p game; well, haters gonna hate.
1) Personally I have found many friends here, people always help newbies (almost too much), some russian players know english, so it is not a problem to communicate. And if you were robbed, that was because u haven't locked your home, not because of your skin color (some people do steal, anywhere).
2) Donat is time-saving and cosmetic. Why would you want to save your gameplaying time? Maybe to catch up with friends, maybe 'cause you want to reach end-game content faster... As for me, I have achieved everything myself, I am playing a little less then 1 month, I already have the largest home possible, and I've enjoyed every single second of the game.
Besides, I have never lost and no one have ever killed my horse, it is easy to catch anyway, so whatever.. If you are so concerned and don't want to donate - you may buy premium horse with ingame currency from other players.
And about scrolls that improve ur items quality: they can in fact lower the quality, so it is not a shop panacea too.

Just try it, very warm feelings for a nice price.
There is a better tutorial now and more options in menu. Just in case tho:
use Ctrl + 'G' or 'L' to hide walls and trees to look through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148940069', 'num_games_owned': 3668, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3881, 'last_played': 1495825133}
review:
The game itself is alright and the dev's update frequently, if you like these kinds of grindy survival mmo's you'll probably like Wild Terra...However, buyer beware. 

It's very rare that I feel the need to leave negative feedback on a game, but considering this dev basically just took away the game from a large portion of it's playerbase...Well, yeah. 

Today's update (5/26/17) disabled the ability to create or run existing private servers without paying for premium time on the public servers. This is an understandable change from a business standpoint but the devs gave no warning or hint that this might be occurring. People with months of progress or tight communities suddenly cannot access those servers without shelling out more money for a game they already paid for. Paying customers that potentially based their entire purchase off the fact that private servers were available and that the game was not subscription based, now have no choice but to pay a reoccurring subscription fee if they wish to continue playing. 

The devs, at the very least, should have told us this was coming. Perhaps they should have grandfathered in existing servers and made creation of any new servers require premium. Springing this gigantic, money costing change on it's player base is unprofessional at best and reputation ruining at worst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011256744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 6194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5286, 'last_played': 1508254225}
review:
The game is one of those that you will pull your hair out one min and want to rage quit and leave a negative review then the next min you will be quietly content.

Ive not met any english players and would have to say 90% are Russian. Not that this is a problem but when they find out your not Russian they steal from you and harass you as much as they can.

The community isnt very helpful either, again mostly because there Russian and dont like non-Russians? With very little in the way of a tutorial and the Wiki is a mess your limited to where you can get info.

The game isnt pay to win like some have suggested, i paid for the premium package and dont have an advantage, Just paying for a horse that cant die really.

I really like the game though, the crafting will have you pulling your hair out and it is a complete grind but i guess thats what its all about. Its actually very similar to LiF: YO but a top down version. The only thing thats making me give it a negative review is the community and lack of tutorial or any kind of helpful info. The Devs also have an attitude problem.

(UPDATE 12/6)

So since my review there have been a few updates that have been for the worse. The game does now appear to favor people who pay. Buying premium time will give you a big exp boost on everything you do. There are a few other things ive heard but as im a premium player i dont know what they are but you can prob find the info online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122599840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1494424983}
review:
A simple but noteworthy Sandbox!

A lot of things to do and discover with a graphics that reminds the old Sandbox Games, but it's nice and beautiful to see.

There are various activities in both PvP and PvE side with the option to choose ONLY PvE servers with PvP areas.

Interesting is the treasure hunt system and the areas with folk monsters called Corrupted Lands.

Recommended for fans of the Sandbox Games and anyone who wants to support developers in this project.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013423444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1519874918}
review:
I am not sure why this game isn't more popular, even with mixed reviews I picked it up and it's actually a nice game. I just started but so far so good. Top down, survival, crafting along with PvP. Somewhat like Life is Feudal, but a different view.  The only bad thing about this game is the population not very many people on any of the servers. 

Recommended !

author: {'steamid': '76561197971358089', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1491068799}
review: This game is quite fun to faff about in, and of course with survival sandboxes, it can be like that. Looking forward to heading onto the PvP server and having my stuff destroyed :D Seriously though it could be fun to work together with strangers and build things, even if it gets destroyed. Social dynamics are fun like that. If you want to try something like Don't Starve but a bit more sandbox MMO-like, this one is worth keeping an eye on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985338890', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1560351907}
review:
simply dont buy...
I love the genre, i loved what was the devs vision of this game, i wanted to support

but:
- 90% russian community (not a general con, only if you dont like to see kyrillic only in public chat)
- no real progress of game state
- cash greedy developers (early access, far from finished and mostly the ingame cash-shop gets updated)
- CASH
- GREEDY
- DEVELOPERS
nuff said...

save your time and money and search some other game - this is not worth the money

author: {'steamid': '76561197980792908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 8367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8367, 'last_played': 1494911906}
review:
a pay2play game that's still pay2win and a developer denying that fact...
but make your own opinion if the following is pay2win to you or not:

you can buy mounts you can't lose (they're invulnerable)
free users have to grind for mounts and those are killable what means you'll need to grind for anotherone if it get's killed

you can buy premium time that doubles experience, resources gained aswell as halved crafting times

you can buy recipes for items that otherwise would be locked behind a huge grinding to obtain

you can buy scrolls to impreove the quality of items that free users would need to kill insanely strong enemies to obtain

you can pay to move your entire base to a new location, free users need to rebuild everything
(and no, you don't get any materials back when destroying a building)

in one of the next updates they're implementing loot chests with equipment in them and guess what?
you'll be able to buy the keys in the store while free players will need to kill insanely difficult enemies to maybe obtain a key

on a side note, if you're thinking that in a game like this the prices can't be that high tio get anything you're wrong, here's a small list to get a general idea about the prices:

500 gold - 2$ / 5000 gold - 18$ / 20000 gold - 65$

premium days:

1 day - 300 gold / 5 days 1100 gold / 30 days 4300 gold

those improvement scrolls
for weapons:
1 - 400 gold / 5 - 1900 gold / 25 - 9200 gold
for anything else:
1 - 250 gold / 5 - 1200 gold / 25 - 5800 gold

mounts ranging from 2900 - 17900 gold

recipes:
1 server: 1 - 240 gold / 5 - 990 gold
all servers: 1 - 320 gold / 5 - 1390 gold

moving your base 2900 gold

if you're fine with that feel free to buy the game, otherwise by all means, stay away from it

______________________________________________________________


EDIT! 1

apparently the most recent update made it even impossible to create "personal" servers without having bought premium time on one of the official servers so by now if one wants to play alone he needs to pay around 15$/month just to do so...
the fact that there are only around 6-10 active players on the official servers while most players played on personal servers i think it's more than valid to call this game dead by now because i highly doubt that anyone's willing to pay 15$ a month for a server with a far worse stability than even the crudest office pc could offer just to play in singleplayer or with a handful of friends!

EDIT! 2

now they've even banned me from the forums because of "massive forum spam" just because i posted a single mesage about the stuff i've written about in EDIT! 1

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=933421187
developer_response:
Where do you get these conclusions from?

1. We have never denied that we have in-game payments. You can see this tag on the store page.
2. Premium bonus does not double the experience. 
3. Recipes that can be bought are also available for obtaining in game ways (in treasures and monsters). It is the same item that is sold in the store.
4. There is no need to move your dominium to another place, it is not an obligatory function and you do not have to buy it.
5. We do not plan to add weapons to the chests, from the chests you can get unique skins.

Why did you invent it all? In-game store is not always a pay-to-win

author: {'steamid': '76561198016511399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1491792152}
review: This game has potential, but it wasn't worth the $15 at this point. There aren't enough players and the characters/models aren't very fluid. The whole things feels pretty clunky right now. I might check this one out again in a year, but for right now I am going to refund it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984231606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3529, 'last_played': 1537347301}
review:
Wild Terra Online is een leuk spel die je alleen of samen kunt spelen. Wanneer je samenspeelt kan je ook taken verdelen wat weer scheelt in het 'grinden' (waar velen het over hebben). Het is waar dat als je de beste items wilt krijgen of meer gebouwen wilt maken, je een hoop moet verzamelen en trainen om levels omhoog te gaan. Dit is echter wel logisch, wanneer je naar welk ander vergelijkbaar spel kijkt zal je dit ook doen (denk maar aan grote MMORPG titels). De regel is: Je kan het zelf zo gek maken als je maar wilt!

Vooral het begin is lastig. Je moet snel opbouwen, veel ruimte krijgen door manden en schuren als opslagplaats te maken. Alles moet je goed trainen, veel verzamelen, je kan snel doodgaan door wilde dieren en je moet de juiste toetsen weten! Het speelt wat anders maar daardoor heeft het spel dus ook iets unieks, je kan op je eigen stuk geclaimde grond (waar dan ook neergezet) bouwen en ermee doen wat je wilt. Om ervoor te zorgen dat inactieve spelers niet allemaal troep achterlaten en het spel onspeelbaar word hebben ze het systeem bedacht om je geclaimde grond automatisch te laten verdwijnen na 10-40 dagen inactiviteit (10 dagen = klein domein, 20 dagen = middelgroot, 30 dagen = groot en 40 dagen = grootste domein). Als je een dag heel actief gespeeld hebt en je best doet, dan kan je die uitbreiding naar een middelgroot domein doen die qua omvang leuk is en 20 dagen lang je basis kan beschermen zonder in te loggen. Na die tijd zal je basis onbeschermd zijn. Dan kunnen andere spelers je basis leegplunderen en zal alles na 24 uur automatisch vernietigen. Dus af en toe inloggen is een must als je een tijdje niet speelt!

Het spel is nog wel in ontwikkeling en er zal nog wel iets aan moeten verbeteren, denk aan een soort tutorial om je op weg te helpen, wat foutjes en nog iets uitbreidden in functies, maar daarmee zijn ze nog volop bezig, het spel is nog beta. 

Ik kan PvP niet aanbevelen voor beginners, dit zal je snel frustreren, de PvE is ideaal om rustig het spel te leren kennen en verkennen.

Heb je interesse en wil je de belangrijkste dingen weten, dan hier een paar tips:
- Gebruik de 'L' om alle gebouwen, muren en bomen te verlagen, zo krijg je meer overzicht in het spel, en kan je beter uitkijken voor roofdieren die rondlopen (en je zullen vermoorden als je te dichtbij komt).
- Gebruik de 'C' om je bouwvenster te openen, via dit venster moet je alles zien te maken, van gereedschap tot muren en gebouwen en zo ook je Domein
- Maak als eerst een Domein en sluit deze rondom(!) af met hekken en 1-2 poorten om er zelf naar binnen te kunnen lopen. Als je dit niet doet en/of een poort open laat staan dan kunnen spelers op jou domein komen en alle spullen stelen. Met lage hekken kunnen spelers ook je spullen pakken als deze tegen de muur aan gezet zijn, dus hier moet je goed op letten!
- Voor de rest, jagen en verzamelen, goed opletten en vooral plezier maken!
- De Nederlandse versie zal spoedig bijgewerkt worden waardoor je het ook in het Nederlands kunt spelen

De NL vertaler van Wild Terra.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106163638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4500, 'last_played': 1497933315}
review:
Die Kurzfassung:
Wer auf Loottouren, suchen von Ressourcen und Craften steht, kein Problem damit hat, dass Ressourcen vernichtet werden, weil die Crafting Skills nicht hoch genug sind und man als AnfÃ¤nger etwas rumknobeln muss, der sollte mal ein Blick drauf werfen.
Das Spiel lÃ¤uft bei mir stabil, es gab bisher keine AbstÃ¼rze. Man ist schnell drin und es lÃ¤uft flÃ¼ssig. Es gibt gelegentlich kurze Ruckler, wenn andere Spieler auftauchen.
Ich habe schon schlimmere Alphas gesehen aber hier kann ich ruhigen Gewissens eine Empfehlung aussprechen aber auch nur fÃ¼r eine Zielgruppe, die auf solche Spiele steht!

Langfassung:
Zugegeben, bis jetzt habe ich "nur" 65 Std. mit dem Spiel verbracht und habe gerade mal die HÃ¤lfte erforscht, bzw. frei geschaltet. Bisher habe ich nur auf der PvE Karte gespielt.
Wild Terra Online zeichnet sich im Grunde durch seine vielen MÃ¶glichkeiten aus.
Man verbringt viel Zeit mit dem Sammeln von Ressourcen und Craften.
Beispiel:  ich fÃ¤lle einen Baum, dabei fallen bis zu 4 Sorten Holz an. Die kann man nun einfach so in den Meiler oder ein Lagerfeuer stecken und weg ist es, oder man verarbeitet es zu Brennholz. Bei letzterem Verfahren hat man mehr von dem Holz, da man damit fast alle Ã–fen bestÃ¼cken kann. Nachteil, man verbraucht viel Zeit und Werkzeuge, in diesem Fall die Axt. Die Steinaxt craftet man zwischendurch mehrmals oder bei hÃ¶heren Leveln auch eine Bronzeaxt wo sich auch die Reparatur lohnt. Je mehr man craftet umso hÃ¶her steigt man in den Leveln, was sich wiederum durch einen QualitÃ¤tsgrad auszeichnet. Diese QualitÃ¤t ist wichtig, denn wenn ich z.b. die Eisenspitzhacke frei geschaltet habe und habe nur eine 10% Chance auf die Herstellung, dann kann es sein, dass man die Hacke 10x baut und 9 mal die Ressourcen vernichtet. Stelle ich aber z.b. EisennÃ¤gel her, dann habe ich eine hÃ¶here Chance das das klappt und damit steigere ich dann auch den Level.

Ich glaube dieser Craftingskill Geschichte ist auch eins der grÃ¶ÃŸten Nachteile wenn man in der Gruppe spielt. Denn hier muss gut abgestimmt werden, wer was macht, damit niemand auf der Strecke bleibt. Alles kann man sowieso nicht von Anfang an craften, denn es fehlen in vielen Bereichen sogenannte Bauanleitungen, die man auf der Karte finden kann.

Ein weiteres Manko ist die schlechte deutsche Ãœbersetzung. Im Text des kleinen HÃ¼hnerstalls steht zb. man braucht ein Huhn und Samen um Eier zu bekommen. Das erweckt den Eindruck dass die Grassamen (Seeds) gemeint sind. Leider habe ich erst spÃ¤ter im Wiki gefunden, dass das Getreide gemeint ist. Die MenÃ¼fÃ¼hrung, empfinde ich ebenfalls als UmstÃ¤ndlich, irgendwann gewÃ¶hnt man sich daran aber am Anfang hatte ich schon meine Probleme. Bestes Beispiel, die Erweiterung des eigenen Claims. Bis ich mal verstanden habe, was mit kleinen Grundsteinen gemeint ist und wo ich die herbekommen, war schon eine Aktion. Da man die kleinen Grundsteine in dem MenÃ¼ findet, wo man Elemente setzt und im HandwerksmenÃ¼ isz die Bauanleitung, wie man diese herstellt.
Das AbreiÃŸen von Teilen war auch so eine Frage. Bis ich mal gefunden habe, dass man hier einen extra Button aufrufen muss, der in einem MenÃ¼ versteckt ist, welches sich nur zeigt, wenn man unten rechts die kleinen Minisymbole anklickt, ist fÃ¼r Neulinge auch nicht hilfreich. Wenn man es einmal weiÃŸ dann ist es gut...
Die BildererklÃ¤rung als kleine EinfÃ¼hrung ist zwar nett aber nicht wirklich hilfreich. Z.b. fehlt die Angabe, nach wie vielen Tagen der eigene Claim gelÃ¶scht wird.
Ãœberhaupt fehlen viele ErklÃ¤rungen zum Spiel. Es gibt zwar ein Wiki aber es hat noch LÃ¼cken, Beispiel, das Reittier Pferd. Es entsteht zunÃ¤chst der Eindruck, dass man Reittiere nur kaufen kann. Im Wiki wird zwar geschrieben, dass man Pferde zwar mit einer Schlinge fangen kann aber nicht, dass man diese anschlieÃŸend auch als Reittier nutzen kann oder ob diese Aktion nur zum Schlachten gut ist, da in der gleichen Abteilung auch alle anderen "Schlachttiere" aufgezÃ¤hlt sind.
Trotz dieser "MÃ¤ngel" habe ich Hoffnung, dass sich alles zum Besseren entwickelt, es ist schlieÃŸlich eine Alpha und mein erster Eindruck ist sehr gut!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071925559', 'num_games_owned': 856, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1490054812}
review:
First off, I want to state that Steam should really have a better rating sistem, a mixed option would be nice. I'm sick and tired of having to be forced to choose despite having mixed experiences with the game. I've went with a thumbs up for Wild Terra Online, because I think it deserves a higher rating that it currently has.

Let me start with a controversial topic a lot of steam reviews mention - the developers. Many people state they had a bad experience and some were banned from the forums, but from what I've talked to them, they seemed professional and friendly. The fact I contacted them on behalf of a review site might have a say in that, but I had no trouble with them whatsoever.

Now let's get to the game itself. If you've played any other sandbox MMORPG, the base principle is quite similar. You spend most of the time gathering resources and crafting/constructing various things. There is a large variety of items to craft, some of which you have to unlock first via recipes. You find those while exploring and when you find enough of them, you unlock a new thing - may it be a structure, piece of equipment or simply a tool. Item variety is a very important thing in a sandbox MMORPG, because it's the only thing to keep you going. You won't have a quest, a story or a predetermined cause - you will be doing what you want and for most people that will be building their base/home and getting better and better gear. 

The skills system is quite nice as well. Quite surprisingly, I've felt discouraged from playing to much, because you get a predetermined amount of bonus exp to help you improve skills each day and when that runs out, leveling them goes down to a crawl. Combine that with the fact that some skills (especially higher levels) require you to spend a lot of resources, you will have to spend more time gathering resources more than you originally intended. That might be fine for someone, who just came home from work and simply wants to relax - grab a pickaxe, run around for a bit and get some metals, however it takes a lot of time to get anywhere. I've been playing for almost 20 hours (granted, some of them were AFK-ing) and I've still only barely managed to get copper gear. It would take a lot more to get to iron or steel. That is, unless you cave in and get micro-transactions.

Because you see, Wild Terra also has those. They are in no way required and only make progress faster, but it's still not a great thing to see, when you already had to spent money on the game itself. Unless the developers get greedy and add game breaking things to the store, I'm fine with it. Really. If someone wants to progress faster or/and look awesome, they are free to use the store but it is in no way required to progress. 

The last gameplay related thing I'd like to touch is combat. It's fairly basic, with some active abilities and the same leveling system crafting related skills use. The PVP servers are not that populated and the main game mode is PvE anyway. You will have to use weapons while hunting but you probably won't go further than that. An expansion of the battle system would be nice, however it is in no way required. 

And lastly, graphics and sound. The graphics don't look bad at all. They went for a realistic look and it fits, however the animations are fairly basic. Don't expect much here but you won't get disgusted by it either. As for the sound, I'd like to mention a weird thing. Every time you open the game, the music is turned off. A minor thing, since you can simply change between three options in-game, but it would be nice if the game would remember the setting that was used the last time.

---------
All in all, Wild Terra Online is a decent MMORPG that requires a lot of time to progress. The unique food system is nice, but it doesn't innovate much in other areas. It still shows some signs of early access, such as sometimes missing structure tooltips and other minor things (I have also noticed a situation that seemed like a memory leak in two separate situations), but none of them should cause major problems or discourage you from playing. If you have a lot of time on your hands and are looking for a sandbox MMORPG, check out some gameplay and if it seems like a game you would enjoy, give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078488193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1508717206}
review:
excelente juego , pero dada la falta de gente en los servidores latinos y que jugarlo solo se hace muy pesado , creo en mi opinion que deberian re-lanzar el juego a comunidades latinas y repartir algunas key denuevo , quizas por 8-10 dolares si estaria bien el riesgo de adquirirlo .
muchas funciones, puedes disfrutar de un rpg, de un sandbox, survival ... en fin mucho, en si el juego cumple lo que promete

mi calificacion es un 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198075068721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1651893868}
review:
The people who made this game are unprofessional, if you don't want to treated like shit don't buy this game, customer should be right all the time. They want your feedback, after you give them feedback they blame you for  You can check forums and see how they treat their customers. They have minors are their mods and developers. They mute you and ban you how they like. 

Perma mute to my husband and he can't trade or talk with anybody in a MULTIPLAYER game. He can't play the game he bought and he can't refund also. They don't care after you buy it, you are useless because they get their money anyways. 

And about to gameplay, i would like to say that, so much grinding, cut 1000 woods, mine 1000 ore, kill 10000 animals, there you go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970742786', 'num_games_owned': 2832, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 4128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1524661717}
review: At this moment, I would not recommend this game. It is fun....for a short while. Then it gets into a great grind. You can't even kill a boar or a wolf and they roam all around you. The devs themselves say, that to kill a boar, you need a good bow and good armor, but you cant get that in the start, you have to find the recipes to get  them and that takes 100's of hours. Really, I have found parts of recipes, but you need multiple of those parts to make a full one and I never got those. So...you cant progress, without those recipes, but you cant find them, because of the wolves and bears guarding those areas, so all you do is sneak around and try to outrun them, but because of armor you go too slow, but if you have light stuff, you get wounded and die when running away and then have to find your body again to get your stuff, before other players do and steal your stuff, etc. And when you tell the devs about this problem, they say you dont know how to play the game and need to practice more, but everyone is saying this. So...that sums it up. This game has potential, but will it ever make it? Who knows? Time will tell!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016748445', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1489129887}
review:
This is the biggest garbage and biggest frustration machine ever created, a wannabe clone of Heaven and Hearth.
dead dead dead dead dead , if you die from an animal the animals stay at your  corpse  so that you basically F**** up because  stuff is too expensive to let it laying there. 1 dead throws you into a frustration spiral, the developer has absolute no idea what a "game" is there is obviously not a single one of them  ever studied barely something into that direction.
The worst whilst all of that facts above its still somewhat addicting, it makes strong use of that "hope dies last" behavior of the  human.

98% of the text  in chat you read is cyrill ,  massive and extreme cheating and grief  must be expected
developer_response:
The game uses a mechanic called "full loot", you can search and read more about it.

On what is based your opinion about cheaters? We check all complaints against cheaters, and if there was any fraud, we are permanently banning violators.

review:
If you get this game all you will do is grind resources.  Everything in this game is a chore you will run around on a 2d map just gathering resources from spawned nodes.    All gear breaks very very fast making it an eternal mining fest.

There is no point to anything you do:

Save your money and your time and pass this wrek over

author: {'steamid': '76561198083330899', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 2330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1489130004}
review:
Este analisis esta realizado desde el early access. 

Un sinfin de posibilidades de crafteo. Numerosas habilidades para mejorar desde recoleccion, caza, herreria, etc...
A la espera de un parche que promete muchisimo contenido a este titulo. Pero me atrevo a recomendar este juego desde su alpha. 

Muy prometedor y espero con impaciencia el nuevo contenido.

Mi valoracion para este titulo es de 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198269508440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1605898805}
review:
Bueno, segundo intento con este juego.

La verdad que termine comprandolo por los viejos momentos que vivi jugando al Ultima Online y este se me hacia similar a simple vista. Pero no es asi, eso no quiere decir que sea malo, simplemente no alcanza a los talones del UO.

Digo segundo intento pero que lo compre y lo reembolse y ahora lo volvi a comprar para darle una chance.

Lo malo simplemente es la casi NULA presencia de jugadores en los servidores latinoamericanos, con decir que hay 3 jugadores estoy siendo generoso, solo hay un promedio de 30 en el servidor de europa, que no anda con lag, se puede jugar, pero son todos jugadores rusos, asi que la comunicacion es muy dificil.

El sistema de crafteo esta bastante entretenido, al igual que la caza y la construccion, creo que son los puntos mas importantes de este juego.

Lo que me desiluciono es que no hay criaturas "extraÃ±as" o "malvadas" para matar, simplemente te puedes enfrentar a osos, jabalies, zorro, lobos y deja de contar, asi que es bastante aburrido el PvE. Aunque ahora vi que van a poner un parche con una tierra maldita y criaturas nuevas, eso va a estar bastante interesante, espero que le de mas vida al PvE, sino simplemente tienes la paz de jugar al Sims y creo que por eso esta tan vacios los servidores PvE (aunque entendi que en algunas zonas de los PvE si se puede hacer PvP).

Otra cosa a rescatar es que cada uno se puede crear un servidor y modificar a su gusto la cantidad de skill ganada, recursos, etc. No se bien por que se puede crear tantos servidores, debe de ser por que esta en testeo. Pero esto esta bueno para conocer bien el juego.

La verdad que espero que le den mas vida por que vale la pena, aunque en este momento por la falta de jugadores es bastante aburrido.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967985876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 31652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24445, 'last_played': 1500305100}
review:
Here is my comment and hope it will serve as a good reference to any players who intented to buy this game.

Some of the good review for this game have been quite old and no reflecting the current game model.

Over the past few month this game have gone from good to worst and the reason are as follow

Siege- the new siege mechanism now can only be done in a fixed interval. Player have no rights to choose the siege time. So the timing maybe at you work hours or sleeping hours depending on your timezone. Recently dev "improve" the siege making it now easy to siege and harder to build. Depending where you live you will lost your effort when you come back from work or sleep,  

Resource - The amount of resource needed to build your domain is ridiculously high. Important resource like iron is very limited. A map with 100 player can have as little as 60 node in the server at the respawn of 30-60 min. That is like at most 1 node and less per person. Player have to grind like mad to lvl up especially in the end game. The new insight  help to imrpove your lvl but you will often find you lack the resource to make the stuff needed for your lvling. Dev also mention they are looking to make endgame resource even more of a grind and harder to get. 

End game-  the game is fun while you are still at your starting stage that where most of the good reviews come in. However, as you reaches end game (iron tools lvl) you will find yourself in a grinding hell. mining, hunting and woodcutting. There is no one to PVP as everyone is busy with their grind. 

Developer - they are unlikely to listen to your comment or ideas and seem to have their owns ideas which they are going implement. Their command of english is not as good which resulted their patch note is a mess. For example" Fixed a bug in the crucible and the crucible workshop, due to which it was possible to obtain steel, excluding costs of cast iron." It did not specified that if you filled those 2 structure to fill up the slots you will lost your stuff. Afterwhich, they shamelessly claim this is the intended function and refuse to reinburse the players who maximise their production building. They seem to think the players are money trees and cutting corners in their "fixed". They also have no issue with implement feature that waste your time.

So I will strongely recommend not to buy this game at the current state it is just a waste of money. There is no one to pvp and the current model is just a endless grind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123319871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1489258403}
review:
Ho acquistato il gioco da molto prima della sua uscita su steam. Lentamente procede il suo sviluppo, sta crescendo. Il problema che odio di piÃ¹ e che me lo fa abbandonare ogni volta che mi vien voglia di riprovarlo, Ã¨ la fame assurda, irrealistica, fastidiosa del personaggio. Mangia troppo, non fai in tempo a fare qualcosa in gioco che devi rimangiare, in pratica perdi tutto il tempo per sfamarti. L'inizio del gioco, se sei da solo, Ã¨ veramente arduo. Sul combat pvp e skill non dico nulla, mai provato. 
Se vi piace il genere, potete seguirlo ( ogni tanto offrono keys gratuite del gioco sui siti ), ma finchÃ¨ non abbassano drasticamente la fame, non mi sento di promuoverlo
developer_response: We have repeatedly simplified the mechanics of eating and now it is not difficult to keep your character fed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043852898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2685, 'last_played': 1674595140}
review:
Ich kann an dieser Stelle nur sagen, das Spiel gefÃ¤llt mir sehr. Wenn es jemandem zu lange dauert, alles zu erlernen dann liegt das eigentlich nur an dem jeweiligen Server. Diese sind einstellbar. Das 2D System stÃ¶rt mich Ã¼berhaupt nicht. Ob Pve oder PvP hier wird fÃ¼r jeden was geboten. Man kann sogar kostenfrei eigene Server erstellen. Diese sind aber nicht geschÃ¼tzt. Alles in allem finde ich es ist ein gelungenes Spiel. Ich vergebe 9/10 Punkten. Ein Punkt Abzug gibt es nur, da man die Server nicht schÃ¼tzen kann.

Es gibt regelmÃ¤ÃŸige Updates, und sogar Wechsel auf die Jahreszeiten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039822905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3740, 'last_played': 1491299211}
review:
almost 65 hours in and still playing. hasn't gotten boring yet, there's much more still to do and it's not grindy like other games. after getting a hang of the game and a bit of a rough start, it gets much more interesting. 


has a lot of potential and looking forward to seeing what happens with the new content coming up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965351205', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1486052309}
review:
Pay2win: mounts that are faster it seems.. not sure if you can tame bears or not at some point so i'm unsure about this, but you can instantly buy a bear for like 30$.

Awesome game if you live in 1998 or so. Otherwise its a watch your ore smelt, cut down 500000 trees, kill 500 ravens, 500 deer. Then you get to make some primitive items. (If you have premium, otherwise double these numbers)

Timesink aside, the game runs poorly, seems like its flash or something.

combat is ok I guess.. (for 1998)

If this game had come out in 1998, I'd say Rust was its spiritual successor and better in everyway.
developer_response: Mounts in the store are not faster than those that you can catch in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988375908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1486177552}
review:
enjoying it , has loads of potential 
would suggest to old school people who like thier graphics like UO
crafting seems pretty diverse , combat i cant speak on to much 
looking forward to night to day transitions and weather
few things that are important for atmosphere and will make the game shine a bit 
im on a pve server and the cash shop is not intrusive in the least to my play style 
thats not to say buying a horse is a bad thing , helps devs fund the game 
the titles , i think all that stuff you should be able to aquire in game at one point 
map seems like it could be more diverse , its missing dungeons and other little diddies , 
but its ea and its a good start as it stands right now

review: Began quite interested in the game, but too many flaws - no flow in development of materials, skills, etc. And you keep dying and losing your stuff. Just got a bit boring and repetitive really quickly. Overall - not particularly impressive though it may have once had potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042482596', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 21118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5638, 'last_played': 1599790870}
review:
Let me preface this: I have only been playing with a friend I know in reality.

I recommend this game, It maybe a bit grindy for some, however this should be one of the games that you play with another person. Sure you can go it alone, but Grinding is much easier done with a second person. 

The price is the largest concern, I think it should probably drop about 5 USD to be affordable across the board.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192665873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1484935594}
review: Highly don't recommen this. I should have listened to all the people who reviewed this and not recommended it. . . so much regret 3 hours gone. Waste of 15 dollars. The game has no purpose. You grind your skills so that you can build a larger more luxurious home and that's it basically. You spend most of your time cutting down trees, killing animals and mining for resources. That's literally the game and the community is dead. Don't waste your time on this game. Read the other reviews.
developer_response: Thanks for review. In patch 8.22, we strongly reduce the importance of grind in the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198010557481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1485169429}
review:
Ich gebe dem Spiel einen Daumen nach oben. Es ist ein gutes Farmspiel im Stil von Life is feudal, nur in 2 D. 
Ich hab auf einem PVE Server gespielt da ich keinen Wert auf PVP lege. 
Mein dickes Minus war...das leveln dauert im verlauf des Spiels unglaublich lange. man muÃŸ Unmengen material farmen um vorran zu kommen, da beim scheitern das material zerstÃ¶rt wird. FÃ¼r Spieler die nicht 24/7 spielen kÃ¶nnen fast unmÃ¶glich alles zu erreichen, da man sich spÃ¤ter spezialisieren muÃŸ um leveln zu kÃ¶nnen.
ABER, ich habe ein tolles Feature entdeckt, jeder Spieler kann sich kostenlos einen eigenen Server mieten und diesen auch im kleinen Rahmen konfigurieren und genau das wiegt mein dickes Minus wieder auf...
Ich hab mir einen eigenen Server erstellt, die Stapelrate, Droprate ect etwas erhÃ¶ht und siehe da..auch alleine kann man sich nun austoben. Man muÃŸ zwar trotzdem viel farmen, aber man kommt vorran .
Das Spiel macht SpaÃŸ, fÃ¼r jeden der solche Spiele mag, man sollte sich auch nicht von der 2d Grafik tÃ¤uschen lassen, man gewÃ¶hnt sich dran und sie ist liebevoll gemacht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014940948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 2408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2001, 'last_played': 1527883453}
review:
The game is still in Alpha, but already has strong basis, notably a nice balancing of the progression, not too easily rewarding, but not grindy-frustrating neither.

In the Pros : 
-Game has its graphic style and a nice Art Direction touch
-UI/Interface is accessible and readable
-Game receives regular updates and is followed by its developper
-Even some seasonnal events with new content (Xmas and else)
-A first solid progression balancing

Still some things that would need improvements for launch : 
-add WASD/ZQSD controls for moving, and not the left-click only
-a search index for crafting ingredients, instead of having to go through all the different crafting recipes to see if an item is useful and for what.
-more wildlife variety (but from Devblog I see it's already incoming)
- some kind of player-base economy tool (auction house, marketplace or something, instead of only direct trade : if you're on a different timezone than your server neighbour, you cannot exchange or trade since you're often alone.
-More social and community tools (guilds, and all associated gameplay, like guilds warfares and such)

It's already a nice Alpha and if continued with the same level of follow-up, could become at launch a really great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139340251', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 52406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31683, 'last_played': 1566061406}
review:
Continuar escribiendo
Excelente juego de supervivencia medieval, te transporta directamente a un mundo completamente hostil, donde la mayor amenaza no son los jugadores, sino el entorno.

Wild Terra, te puede gustar si buscas un survival bastante difÃ­cil, y remarco lo de difÃ­cil, el progreso es LENTO, pero lento que da miedo, llevo jugando 2-3 semanas, y aun no puedo fabricar una armadura de cuero.
Jugar wild terra lleva consigo el aceptar que este juego no te va a dar las cosas en la mano, desbloquear recetas es laborioso, el subir tus habilidades, conseguir ciertos recursos, todo lleva tiempo y esfuerzo.

Te recomiendo que lo juegues con amigos o busques un grupo, el juego se facilita mucho mas asÃ­, dividiendo las tareas entre jugadores.

PVP: INTENSO, las mecÃ¡nicas parecen bÃ¡sicas, pero al momento de ver como las flechas van y vienen, y los guerreros en primera linea avanzan es Ã©pico.

Cosas malas del juego: 
-El juego es MUY lento, lo cual, me gusta, pero a mucha gente le termina por aburrir al ver que no progresa casi nada a diferencia de como se progresa al principio.
-La gente, en algunos servidores es escasa, Iktos (Servidor Brasilero) hay algo de 30 personas en hora pico, nada comparado a Ignos (Servidor Europeo) que tiene una gran mayorÃ­a de jugadores online.

Este juego es genial, pero muy grupo-dependiente, vas a hacer poco en este juego jugÃ¡ndolo solo, por suerte, seas del paÃ­s que seas hay gente de muchos idiomas, si sos bueno y dedicado algÃºn clan te va a dejar entrar.

Recomendadisimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121395620', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2803, 'last_played': 1483915065}
review:
Pay to win, hardcore grinder, very few people, really bored

gameplay really slow without premiuns bonus, mounts.

u want a horse? ok, grind 45-60hours, but in the shop pay and done!
developer_response:
What can you buy in the store, which will allow you to win?
Read attentively the premium only accelerates the performance of actions (for example, if you collect apples for 2 seconds, then having the premium you collect them for 1 sec). In your opinion, it is pay2win?

author: {'steamid': '76561198031713759', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2065, 'last_played': 1548449442}
review:
If you enjoy griding your arse off for no gains to have the items you have farmed be wasted and get NOTHING for th time and effot you put in getting the things to make what ever it is you wanted to TRY and make as the game wont let you make anything as your to busy being chased around by bears and wolfs that spawn every 2 yards and CANT be killed even though you need pelts from them to make KEY ITEMS in the game that you will never own. But dont worrie as you wont even be killing a boar or deer either. this game is a huge waste of money and time and if you have any sence dont buy it but if you must play it go to G 2 A . c o m as its over half the price it is on steam!.


Edit* And now no2 is coming out we are expected to pay for beta play surly people like me who paid full price for the first showed out all the problem's the game had and went to the trouble of leaving a review. Should we not be the people to test the new game the people who found REAL faults with the original and get some real constructive input!! 

They now feel its also ok to charge people who paid for the game monthly to even keep playing not that you would the game is a garbage fire you wouldn't even P  I  S  S on.

Stay away it all feels like the first game don't pay the bills anymore so we are being giving another turd to polish and pay for the whole thing!
developer_response: Thanks for review. In patch 8.22, we strongly reduce the importance of grind in the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198315216651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 33942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19752, 'last_played': 1659783953}
review:
Great game, but nothing to do but build and craft. Animals are hard to kill solo so friends are needed. the chat system is too hard to see and not very user friendly


Many updates later, the game is much better and alot more fun to play now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292791450', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3061, 'last_played': 1582784322}
review: After a few hours of playing wild terra I'm totally addicted to this game now I started playing this game solo which was boring but showed Frieda the video at first they didn't like it but saw the pvp and open full loot lol which is fun all my friends started playing and we play on a pvp server where their are no safe zones but we built our bases close to each other and honestly best fun game ever with more people!!  Honestly if you like open loot pvp based games this is it for you I use to play Ãºltima online and this does bring back good old memories !!! I recommend this game for anyone looking for a pvp open full loot game.... but if your looking for an EZ open full loot game.... where everything is easy then this is not the game for you this game requires a lot of time dedication

me parece buen juego
pero me come toda la memoria ram del pc

author: {'steamid': '76561197984985614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 4255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3383, 'last_played': 1521846648}
review:
Game is a laggy mess. Offline raiding is the only way people do "PVP" and actual PVP is impossible to get an engagement. Nakeds can just run around you and there's so much delay in hotkeys/weapons that people can simply walk away.

Fun for about 40 hours and after that just a boring/grindy shitshow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013053009', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1584927686}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007958678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3274, 'last_played': 1482518845}
review:
Rust + UO

Build stuff, kill dudes and take their stuff, progress your knowledge of how to build stuff.

Pretty fun and quite addictive, despite the main mechanics being starvation and inventory management.

Bug are minor if any, there's enough content already to keep you fighting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006977426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1595685531}
review:
CcÃ  tous !
Je ne comprends pas les rageux pour moi ce jeu est tres bien mais en alpha!

Pour qu il soit mieux il faudrait plus de monde , pendant mes partie je rencontre 5 Ã  6 joueurs sur le serveur enfin je croise les persos apres je sais pas combien on est en tout Ã  jouer !!.

Il me faudrait une map de toute urgence ne pas pouvoir me reperer par rapport a la grandeur de la map me stress beaucoup! (on connait l implacement de sa base en permanace par contre ca ce st bien)

Les graphismes sont pas moches et les possibilitÃ© de craft du jeu en construction est impressionant,
comme je le repete ce st un jeu finalement online mais au final on est bien seul dans son domaine !

J encourage les Devs pour me remotiver les troupes avant les sorti final !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969727318', 'num_games_owned': 2235, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2276, 'last_played': 1513365009}
review:
Disclaimer:  Steam does not have a neutral review rating.  Just recommended or not recommended.

I have completely rewritten the review so if some of the people in the comments section don't make sense this may be why.

Since I had a negative experience with the devs, I will leave the review as not recommended.  I will cover this below.

Wild Terra as it stands right now is an early access title.  It has been getting regular updates, usually small ones sprinkled with larger ones here and there.  The title has come a long way in the last 6 or so months before it hit Steam just in terms of character movement which has helped immensely.

I have only played on a PvE server so cannot vouch for the play on a PvP server.  The game is slow paced which I like.  I can sit back and relax while playing.  Game play consists of running around the map collecting resources for building up your dominion (what the game calls your base of operations).  Once you have your dominion built then you can work on expanding it and/or collecting resources to make into useful items needed for the extensive amount of recipes found in the game.  

While wandering the map you can find godsends, which come in the for of decomposed adventurers or crashed wagons.  Inside the godsends you can find items as well as recipe fragments.  The recipes you cannot make from the beginning of the game can be found in these godsends.  Each recipe requires a certain amount of fragments to be found before you can create that item.  From what I can tell it can take from 1 to I believe 4 or 5 fragments to unlock specific recipes.  It seems that once you do unlock a recipe that some recipes have a gold recipe that can be unlocked.  The crafting is deep in the game.

The Map:  This is the biggest issue I have with the game.  Everything is player driven (which isn't a bad thing).  There are no NPC cities or towns.  Everything on the map is one flat surface with trees, water, wild life, and resource nodes.  There is absolutely nothing that stands out that you could reference as to where you are in the world.  Once you have a dominion, you get a marker on the edge of the screen that you can use to get back, but that's it.

Player base:  This is where the game shines for the most part.  Most people in the global chat are very helpful and willing to help people out with questions and issues they have.  Some people leave a chest or storage outside for others to come along and rummage through for anything they may need.  During the Christmas event (before the devs lowered the cost) the stockings were hard to make because they needed a loom which unlocks from recipe fragments (found in godsends) and most weren't able to  make them.  One good person on the server would make the items you needed if you brought them the resources.

The devs:  I was wrongly banned from the Steam forums and it took a week before they realized I was wrongly banned and unbanned me.  The devs seem to just willingly ban anyone from their forums that speak bad about the game or the cash shop or in my case ban the wrong guy.  Instead of making a sticky at the top of the forums that lists exactly what is in the cash shop and opening it to discussion.  I feel everyone that is on the fence about the game has a right to know as much information on the game before they make a purchase.  So that brings up the next part.....

Cash Shop:  Once in the game, you can bring up the cash shop.  Inside you will find titles you can bestow on your character along the lines of Duke and Knight and a handful of others.  If you want a mount, you can pick from horses, deer, wolves, and bears.  If you want to dip into their premium  offering you can get a bonus for your character for a period of time based on how much you wish to spend.  I tried to see what the time length was for this review but the cash shop wouldn't come up for me at time of writing this review.  The premium is described (I wrote this down earlier when I was replying to someone) as:  Doubles chances to get rare items, gathering, building, and crafting speed.  As a PvE player this doesn't bother me in the least.  I don't care what the other guy is getting or what he is doing.  In a PvP setting I can see this as being an issue as the other guy is now pulling out double resources on some of the harder to find resource nodes in the world.  If the rare drop is (no clue what the actual drop rate is) 10% then the premium player is getting 20%.  

Due to how the premium is worded this is how I see it as working.  It could be double to getting rare items and an increase to gathering, building and crafting.  Even though an increase in rares can still be an advantage depending on the drop rate imposed in the game.

Is the game bad?  No and I feel I more than received my monies worth during my past and most likely future game play.  As an early access title the content is limited despite the large amount of items you can craft.  This is an issue that plagues many early access titles and is the bane of the whole ea system in general except for a few exclusions.

I do recommend Wild as the game itself, but you must realize what the game is and what it isn't.  It is not an action packed game full of dazzling sword play and fireballs whizzing inches from your face.  In fact there is no magic to speak of.

I do not recommend Wild Terra based on the actions of the developers.  They seem like they care about the game and are definitely actively working on it, but deleting posts in the Steam forums and banning is definitely not the way to go and sends off bad vibes to current customers and prospective customers.  They need to take the good with the bad, embrace it and use that feedback to allow the game to flourish. 

Verdict: Neutral.  If what you have read appeals to you and you can get past the developers then you can find a nice little time sink here.  If you're like me and try to answer questions for other people in the forums and just be an all around nice guy, then beware that you should probably not talk about the cash shop in any form at least until the devs smarten up and just embrace the contents they provide in the shop and not try to hide them.
developer_response: Hello. Accept my apologies, you were accidentally blocked. You have been unban on forums. Once again, sorry for the incident

author: {'steamid': '76561198092697540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2548, 'last_played': 1483384469}
review:
I have to start by saying that anyone who says that this game is anything like Ultima Online has clearly not played it.
This game lacks so much content that the game consists of literally running outside in a small map for all day long to get very few materials(server has like 20-30 peoplein a good day). Not only this but after wasting your entire day scavenging for materials in an unpopulated server, anything you want to create requires HOURS, or a very boring and tidiuos cycle. As an example ill touch cooking, where if you want to make lets sayyy... porriage, you would have to: 
1. Farm barley(wait about 12hrs for it)
2. go get clay and A LOT of wood
3. make clay into uncooked pots
4. cook plate with more wood(takes FOREVER)
5. go back make RAW porriage
6. cook the plate with porriage again
7. eat it, which destroys the plate/pot

all this takes about a whole days worth or more for one miserable low grade food that only fills one of 5 hunger groups.
so lets say u did this, that eas ur entire days worth ofgsling and/or more. 

Another thing is the exploita of really bad mechanics like trapping an animal and raising ur weaponry skills in ur house to max ina fee hours which makes pvp VERY FUN.  Lietrally train archery and axes and u win thr game,  the slow is pretty much death.

I can go on literally all day about how bad this game is, but that would put even more hours ive already wasted on this waste of time. If you want to play a fun survivor I would say try any other than this. Unless ofcourse, you enjoy farming materials and doing nothing else in a game. Has nothing close to the games it claims to be similar to
developer_response: Thank you for your review. During the last few updates, we have simplified the food system. We will strive to ensure that grinding and survival elements did not cause negative impressions

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 2538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2522, 'last_played': 1499213248}
review:
Changing my review to negative. Only the early hours were fun and that was only due to the hope I had and before the Devs began revealing their true intent and ddirection. Which was about 40 of them, the hours since have only been logging in for a few minutes every week hoping things would change.  I DEEPLY regret this purchase, and the hours spent. I thought it would develope into what it appeared to be at first, a clone of Haven and Hearth. Yet I suppose the procedural map egenration as opposed to static map disallows all the mechanics of that type of game to exist, or they just don't want to. It's basically a POINTLESS game, you can craft crap, over and over and over. no real quality system, no real farming system, I only log in now once a week to keep my "time-rented" claim and the work it took to make it, if you don't log in for 7 days you lose it all. Now they plan on intriidcuing "chests and keys"..LMAO whatver. Avoid it, it's not worth it, it is fun for a few hours but then, well, you will see the absolute pointlessness of the game in general. Below if my "only had 4 hours" review, you can see the hopes and now you see the end result. Do not bother, it is not worth supporting. It also became the most shocking SCAM game I've ever seen. They want you to pay 15$ just to own it, then to not have your "home" not decay or to make use of the ability to have your own server they want high as 15$ PER MONTH. Yes, they have a huge item mall, it is big time P2W (Or actually pay to progress). Never support these kind of rediuculous games. Russian Devs should tell you all you need to know it seems, at least in this case every stereotype is TRUE.

And the post that got me banned, like most anyone who dares call them out. :

sounds like the usual threats you've become known for in here.. Why you did what? What way? You mean you want me to ask you why you released a pay to play game, then months later implemented a subscription @ 15$ a month to create a huge feature devide between players who do and players who do not? Why would I need to ask you why you did that? Dissapointed in a game going in totally different direction than what it seemed when it was released and people laid out their money to support you? Yeah very much so. What kind of suggestion would you like? What kind of suggestion could you possibly be interested in and what would it matter? 

But ok, here's one for you, even if I COULD figure out what there is left to do now, I have ZERO desire to play little pvp crap. (Or I would have stayed at Haven and Hearth) Yet you take all the ore spawns and put them in PVP zones? For silly premium users to camp and attack non-premium users? so they have something to do with their item mall stuff and premium feature progression? IS that really needed on casual PVE servers?

review:
Aunque el juego estÃ¡ muy verde, es ya una pequeÃ±a joya para los amantes del crafteo, la construcciÃ³n, etc. con total libertad. Siendo una alfa, tiene ya mucho contenido, una gran cantidad de Ã­tems para fabricar.

Con su apariencia clÃ¡sica, con grÃ¡ficos simples y noventeros, parece poca cosa, pero tiene gran proyecciÃ³n en su gÃ©nero, o al menos a mÃ­ me lo parece, siempre y cuando los desarrolladores no lo descuiden y vayan implementando sus potencialidades.

Estando en esta fase, ya da para muchas horas de vicio, entre otras cosas porque los crafteos son cada vez mÃ¡s lentos, a medida que avanzas en el desarrollo de tus herramientas, edificios, etc.

El punto flaco, en estos momentos, creo que es sobre todo la monotonÃ­a del paisaje, le falta mÃ¡s vidilla para que resulte mÃ¡s agradable moverte con tu personaje por el mapa.
